Summary: Great motel,  if your sole purpose is sleep there when you go to Disneyland and that is it. Nothing spectacular. Coffee in the lobby?  Maybe. But not when you want it or need it.  Most times, not.  "Grab and go breakfast"?  How about "Crap and go"?  A dollar store muffin and granola bar? Really?  Rooms were clean. But the hotel, including lobby, was depressing. The people who worked there seemed board and depressed. No life to them. But my family was fine, since our real focus was Disneyland. Wasn't horrific. But I wouldn't go out of my way to recommend it either.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your thoughts about your stay with us. We are happy our location close to the Disneyland was perfect for your needs and that you were satisfied with your clean room. However, we are sorry for not being able to impress you with our breakfast offerings and for your disappointment with our customer service. We appreciate you letting us know how we can improve as well as what we are doing right. We hope you will give us another opportunity to provide you with the excellent experience you deserve. Thank you!      Sincerely, General Manager

Summary: Room was dirty as other guests have said. Rude receptionist on evening shift not helpful at all. No housekeeping service have to exchange your used towels. I would think if you had to stay here it would be doable but would not recommend this place. The Free Parking was about the only bonus.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay and your feedback. We have read your comments and are sorry to hear we did not deliver a fresh and clean suite during your stay. We are very passionate about providing our guests with clean accommodations, and we apologize we fell short in this case. We have shared your comments with our Housekeeping Manager to see where we went wrong so any  necessary improvements to our processes can be made.  We would also like to apologize if any of our team members appeared rude or unfriendly. We would appreciate the opportunity to provide you with an excellent stay on a future visit to the area.  Sincerely, General Manager

Summary Heading: Good stay, very friendly and helpful staff
Summary: The stay was very nice and warm, the staff was very nice and friendly especially the girl behind the desk named Cheryl. She went out of her way to help us find a good option to revalue using local transport.
Manager Response: Thank you for the feedback regarding your recent stay at Extended Stay America - Orange County - Anaheim Convention Center. It's so great to read that Cheryl our front desk staff made your visit a memorable one. She is definitely one of the favorites of our guests and I will make sure to recognize her efforts. Thanks again, we look forward to your next stay.  Sincerely, General Manager

Summary: We have been to several hotels near Disneyland in the past. This one was based solely on price and offer of the amenities we required. Parking is free, wifi is free and breaky is free as well as a good little kitchenette (some utensils included but not much. No dishsoap either). For how long we actually spend in our room its just fine. Our room is clean and the beds are clean and comfy which is always my priority. The switchplates and plugins are kind of gross but this strikes me as an older property that has had a cosmetic upgrade but not much else.  The walls are a little thin or maybe the neighbor has cement shoes but its liveable. The lobby and common areas have a funky smell that isnt very nice. Staff is friendly and courteous. We would likely stay here again.
Manager Response: We appreciate you choosing to stay at Extended Stay America - Orange County - Anaheim Convention Center. We are happy to know you found us to be a good value and that you liked your room with a kitchenette. We are happy to read your overall visit was satisfactory, and that you and your family will be visiting us again when in our area.   Sincerely, General Manager

Summary Heading: The receptionist was very rude, it seamed that i had to wait for her to finish her lunch brea
Summary: room was dirty, there was popcorn under the chair, there was a counterfeit pen under the bed, the room was  smelly , at this point i don't even know if the bed was cleaned. i will never reccommend anybody here
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. I apologize that our front office team fell short of providing you with the excellent service that we strive for daily.  The cleanliness and room condition you describe is unacceptable and not at all representative of our quality standards. We are meeting with staff members to discuss this situation and reiterate the importance of impeccable customer service and attention to detail.  We invite you to come back and validate the changes we will be implementing and to experience the stay you expect and deserve.  Thank you!    Sincerely, General Manager

Summary: We stayed her for a weekend volleyball tournament.  The hotel was filthy, our room was disgusting/smelly and the staff were rude and not helpful. "Breakfast" consisted of bad muffins, instant oatmeal and granola bars. Worst hotel ever.   Our room had been painted that day, so the room stunk of a strong paint smell, the front desk staff was rude and not accommodating at all. There were black hairs on the disgusting blanket on the bed, there was paint on the toilet paper roll, the walls or so thin you can hear everyone above you and in the adjoining rooms. The hotel has images online that must reflect ONE ROOM in the entire hotel.  We had other friends who also stayed there and their room smelled like fish.   This hotel is a joke and should not be rated as high as it was. It is a
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and for your review. We are so very sorry to see you did not have a very good experience and that you found your accommodations to be poorly cleaned and maintained. What you encountered is not the norm for us and we have addressed this with our entire staff from housekeeping to hospitality. We can do better and your feedback helps us to recognize our shortcomings. Thank you for staying with us during your special event and we hope to make it up to you on a future visit to the area. We would love the opportunity to show you a much improved stay.   Sincerely,  General Manager

Summary: We checked in with the help of Cheryl at the front desk. She is the kindest person that I have ever met at a hotel front desk. She made us feel welcomed and helped us settle down. When we needed some help with our room, she was readily available to help out, and always with a jovial and friendly smile. She is a contagiously very relaxed and compassionate asset to that facility.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review filled with so many kind comments! We are thrilled to hear you had a great stay with us at Extended Stay America - Orange County - Anaheim Convention Center and that the service you received from Cheryl contributed to making your stay a great one. She is a true asset to our team, and we will be sure to share your compliments. Again, thank you for your feedback, and we hope to see you again soon!     Sincerely, General Manager

Summary: The staff here is always wonderful. They are always helpful. Cheryl is always very helpful. She is always polite and kind. Goes out of her way for guest. I have used this hotel alot. I would recommend it to anyone travelling to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing Extended Stay America - Orange County - Anaheim Convention Center once again for your accommodations. We appreciate you mentioning our friendly, helpful staff. We pride ourselves on 100% guest satisfaction, so we are thrilled this was your experience. Your compliments will be shared with the team, especially with Cheryl, for a job well done. We appreciate you recommending us online and hope to see you again soon.  Sincerely, General Manager

Summary: This is our 2nd time staying here and we have had good stays both times. The staff was very courteous and helpful during our stay. The things we liked most about our stay: room was clean and liked the hardwood flooring vs carpet, which can get really dirty. We did a sweep of the floor and it was really clean. Since it is an extended stay, we had a full size fridge and micro, which was nice. They had a small free breakfast. Plenty of free parking and free WiFi. They also had the big carts to haul your things to the room which is nice so we didn't have to make multiple trips to the car.  The breakfast is minimal but they advertise it as such. The walk was a bit far from Disneyland but it was walkable, we walked it daily. Overall, it was a good stay!
Manager Response: We are delighted you chose to stay at Extended Stay America - Orange County - Anaheim Convention Center once again. We appreciate your wonderful remarks and are happy to read you enjoyed the cleanliness of your accommodation and the complimentary amenities we offer. Our staff works hard to exceed our guests' expectations and to make sure they have a relaxing experience. Reviews like yours make it all worthwhile. Thank you for being our guest, and we hope you and your family will visit us again the next time you are in the area.  Sincerely, General Manager

Summary: You're standard kind of hotel, but everything was a little bit worse. Hotel is pretty musty/dusty and really aggravated our allergies. Breakfast was a joke - oatmeal in a paper cup - "may I have some more sir?". We arrived and they had given our room to someone else! We had to scramble to find a room that night. Ridiculous.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and for staying with us. I am so very sorry to hear about the reservation issues you experienced at check in and for the incontinence. I am happy to see we were able to work it out so you could stay with us. We are also sorry our complimentary breakfast offerings did not meet your satisfaction. When we receive this type of valuable feedback, it is always shared with our Brand Leaders so they have knowledge of our guests' desires regarding breakfast choices and assists them in determining new future offerings. Thank you for your feedback, and please consider staying with us again.     Sincerely, General Manager

Summary Heading: NEVER, EVER have I had this kind of treatment over 25/30 years of travel! Had to write.
Summary: 07/27/16  To Whom It May Concern:  While visiting several Hotels in the Anaheim area to pick somewhere for my kids and I to stay for our Summer break, I made a visit to the extended stay America on Clementine Street. I had never visited an extended stay of America before. This was my first experience and wow, I was in complete shock at my discovery.  I had to wait a little while at the front desk because the lady was busy with a couple of customers. One family was checking in. Another lady was at the counter who had an issue. The first impression I had was how clean the property was. My second, a much more important one was the astonishing customer service I have ever seen. (I own a music business that has several franchises in the US hence I have spent the last 30 years
Manager Response: It is so nice to read your excellent review of your visit at Extended Stay America - Orange County - Anaheim Convention Center. Our goal is to make sure all our guests are completely satisfied with their experience, and it is pleasing to read that we were able to ​achieve it in your case. We make every effort to provide the level of service you deserve, so it is nice to hear when our hard work is recognized. Your comments have been shared with all our team members, as it motivates them to perform even better. Thank you for being our guest, and we look forward to your stay!   Sincerely, General Manager

Summary: We have a family of 4 and reserved a 2 double bed room for one night.  When we checked in we were told that they could not accommodate our reservation for one room with 2 double beds and had to give us two separate rooms with one queen bed in each room.  Only one room was ready. When we got to our room it had an odd smell and the room was not well ventilated.  We had no place else to go so we tried to make the best of it and stayed in the room to take a nap and take a bath before going back to Disneyland.  After a couple of hours, the room still smelled.   Our second room was finally ready.  This room was down the hall and did not have a smell.  So we moved all of our things to the new room. We had accepted that we would have to sleep separately - 1 parent and 1 child per room
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your review. We are terribly sorry about the issues you experienced with your reservation, and even more so that we did not appropriately correct the situation. Your comments have been discussed with the team and we are reviewing our procedures so this does not happen again. We are so very sorry for the inconveniences we cause changing rooms so many times. This was not the experience we had hoped for you. Thank you for your feedback, and we hope you will give us another chance to make this up to you and demonstrate excellent hospitality from our team. Thanks again for being our guest and sharing your feedback.     Sincerely, General Manager

Summary: Took a trip to LA and needed a place that was safe, budget friendly, and central to everything we wanted to do--this place fit the bill. I got an excellent rate on hotwire express deal ($62 a night).   We arrived early (2 hours early) and the hotel was very accommodating in letting us in early. We were MUCH appreciative of this because we had drove 12 hours at that point and wanted to rest. The staff and front desk were all very nice and friendly.  Upon arrival, we were informed about the kitchen supplies, maid service, and breakfast! So, I'm not sure about all the reviews that say otherwise. There are also flyers in the room telling you the same thing. Some people just cannot read I guess.  The room itself was clean upon arrival which is a big deal to me. The kitchen area was
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing Extended Stay America - Orange County - Anaheim Convention Center for your stay. We are delighted that you loved the great value we offer for the price, our welcoming front desk associates who took great care of you and our convenient location which was perfect for your needs. We are also happy you liked your spacious, clean, and comfortable suite with lots of room to relax and with all the in-room amenities which made you feel like home. Our housekeeping and maintenance teams work hard to ensure every guest enjoys their stay, so they will be pleased with your feedback. It is also great to read that you were impressed with our complimentary grab-and-go breakfast, laundry service and all the other facilities that we have to offer. However, we are sorry for the noise issues you had and the inconvenience it might have caused. Thank you again for being our valued guest. We look forward to your next stay with us soon.  Sincerely, General Manager

Summary Heading: Good Value/Reasonable Walk to Disney Resort
Summary: The room was quiet and the bed was quite comfortable.  We had a full kitchen available but only used the fridge.  The grab-n-go breakfast is a good idea, but more appealing items could have been offered.
Manager Response: Thank you for selecting Extended Stay America - Orange County - Anaheim Convention Center for your visit and for sharing your comments. We are happy you liked your well-equipped, peaceful accommodation and that our location was perfect for your needs. Although we are glad you liked our breakfast offerings, we truly appreciate your observation regarding the same. It was our pleasure serving you, and we hope to have you back with us soon.  Sincerely, General Manager

Summary: I stayed there for 3 days. It was very clean and pleasant. All the workers that we interacted with treated us kindly and made us feel very welcome. I really like the full kitchenette and the fridge. We had everything that we needed :) Breakfast wasn't much, but I like their chocolate muffins! I just wish it was available until 10 - 10:30 :P We had to borrow a wine opener at 9 - 10 one night and the front desk lady was very kind and accommodating.   The only complain I had was when we asked about the Anaheim bus service (ART?) to go to Disneyland, the lady in the front desk didn't give clear directions as to where the bus stop was so we ended up going around and missed the bus, and had to wait for 25 minutes before another one arrived. But I guess that was partly our faults :)
Manager Response: It was a pleasure having you as our guest at Extended Stay America - Orange County - Anaheim Convention Center. We are pleased to read that you liked our well-kept property, welcoming associates and your accommodations along with the fully equipped kitchen. We are also happy that our complimentary grab-and-go breakfast was to your liking. However, we are sorry for any inconvenience caused. Thank you for choosing our hotel, and we hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely, General Manager

Summary Heading: Budget hotel within easy walking distance of Disneyland
Summary: My wife & I had to take a business trip to LA & wanted to visit Disneyland while we were in the area. We looked all over for a decent hotel to stay in that wouldn't break the bank... everything close to Disneyland (within walking distance) seemed to be $150+/night.   A friend recommended we check for any Extended Stay hotels - & I'm glad he did. We found this place for under $100/night, & even better, it was only about a 15 minute walk to the entrance to Disneyland/California Adventure.   It's nestled in between some other brand-name hotels on S. Clementine, & is just a 100 yards or so from the Garden Walk mall, & several really great places to eat including Cheesecake Factory, California Pizza Kitchen, Fire N Ice, & more.  PROS: -location -price -Celena at the front desk was
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Extended Stay America - Orange County - Anaheim Convention Center for your stay during your visit to the Disneyland. We appreciate your nice comments about our convenient location and are glad it was perfect for your needs. It is also great to hear you found us to be of a great value, and that you were pleased with our courteous desk associate and your well-appointed room. However, we apologize for the inconvenience caused. Your feedback is appreciated. We do our best to share all of the information about our services and amenities to each and every guest, but we can always improve and we will do just that. We value your business and look forward to serving you and your wife again in the near future.  Sincerely, General Manager

Summary: -Located across from the employee entrance of the Disneyland Toy Story parking shuttle lot so you cannot enter it from there, but you can walk around and use the other entrance (~15 minute walk) to use these shuttles for free. We ended up doing uber one day ($10 one way to the Disneyland entrance during peak hours) and the rest of the days we bought the ART shuttle passes for $5/day. These were really convenient, came every 20 minutes (you can text the service to get real time shuttle info), you can take either line 7 or 8 and usually were not too crowded.  -I got an awesome rate of ~79/night on priceline (filtered using 2.5 stars) but ended up with 1 queen bed so I called them and they were nice enough to upgrade me to 2 double beds. This includes wifi/parking/breakfast. Yes
Manager Response: Thank you for giving us your candid feedback regarding your stay. We work hard to make every guest's stay an excellent experience, however, we are sorry we were unable to meet your expectation completely. I have shared your comments with my team so that we can look into the areas of improvement. On the positive side, it was good to read that our staff took good care of you and you liked many aspects of our hotel, especially our convenient location close to Disney Park. Thanks once more for staying with us, and we would love the opportunity to serve you again.     Sincerely, General Manager

Summary: The walls are so thin you can hear your neighbors talking. You have to pay to have them clean your room. The fan in the bathroom didn't work. The "free" breakfast was a cardboard muffin or orange.  Not helpful if you are hitting a park all day. Not to mention nothing for gluten free parties. The toilets and tub were very dirty. Dishes cost extra.
Manager Response: We thank you for selecting our hotel for your recent stay, and for sharing your feedback.  We work hard to create a home away from home environment for our guests with clean, well maintained suites with helpful and friendly service.  We also feel it is important for our guests to have a nutritious start to their day with our complimentary grab and go breakfast.  We apologize we did not meet your expectations in several areas and that you did not leave 100% satisfied.  We appreciate you bringing our shortcomings to our attention, and we apologize we did not deliver a clean suite, and you were disappointed in our breakfast offerings.  Our kitchenware items are always complimentary and when requested we will deliver them to your suite.  We are sorry our team did not communicate our weekly cleaning service program, and our express service is available at a nominal fee.  We can understand your disappointment.  We will work hard to be better, and invite you back to stay so you can have the stay you expected and deserve. Sincerely, General Manager

Summary: A last minute booking. A first extended Stay America experience. I would never pick an extended Stay. Our first choices are Hilton, Ramada, Clarion, Wyndham, Disneyland Hotel or Paradise Pier when in this area. Even an occasional Doubletree or Holiday Inn when choices are slim. However, Memorial Day weekend, last minute booking, and this was one of the few left to choose from, so I picked it cause it is a name I am semi-familiar with. Well while not the super fancy larger hotels, it met my first two nights needs (I did get the rest of my stay at Paradise Pier), but it was the actions of Celena that made it "extra special"! I am used to a business center for printing needs and in this case my daughter wanted a "dance bingo card" for her and two friends to keep her amused during
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing a wonderful review of your visit to Extended Stay America - Orange County - Anaheim Convention Center during the Memorial weekend. Our goal is to make your stay as comfortable as possible and to assist you with whatever you need, so it's nice to know our team accomplished this during your visit. We appreciate your nice comments recognizing the service provided by our welcoming associates, especially Celena, and they will love to hear your compliments. It was a pleasure serving you, and we look forward to welcoming you and your family again in the future.    Sincerely, General Manager

Summary: Great place to stay wonderful staff. Always clean. My first choice always. I have been coming here for years. Never a problem. The manger is great. The staff always has a smile on there face.if you are planning a trip this place should be your first place.....
Manager Response: We are thrilled you chose Extended Stay America - Orange County - Anaheim Convention Center again to be your home away from home. We, too, believe our reasonable rates, fully equipped kitchens, free WiFi, pet friendly, grab-and-go breakfast, 24 hour on-site laundry services and the exceptional customer service are just a few of the services which provide a positive experience when you are traveling. Thank you for your loyalty to our hotel and for recommending us. We look forward to having you and your friends as our guest again soon! We appreciate your wonderful feedback!    Sincerely, General Manager

Summary: I think it has good location to Disneyland. We can see fireworks too. Walking distance n close to all amenities. The room is good. We arrived really early around 8am from airport n they stored our bags at the receptionist. They also promised to give us the earliest room available. Check in was 2 I believe, but they got a room for us by 11.30. The breakfast was okay. Its fruit, coffee, tea n hot chocolate. Muffins n porridge. There is no limit so you can take more if u think 1 is not enough.
Manager Response: Thanks for posting a review so future travelers can read about your pleasant experience here at Extended Stay America - Orange County - Anaheim Convention Center. We are pleased to read that you liked our convenient location, front-desk service and your accommodation as well. We are also happy you were comfortable here and that you took advantage of our complimentary grab-and-go breakfast. It was our pleasure serving you, and we hope to have you back with us soon.  Sincerely, General Manager

Summary: Rooms were fine but to advertise a breakfast is very misleading. Their definition of the first meal of the day is basically some snacks. The offering of instant oatmeal could be ok but there is no milk - I guess they think Coffeemate (CORN SYRUP SOLIDS, HYDROGENATED VEGETABLE OIL, DIPOTASSIUM PHOSPHATE, MONO- AND DIGLYCERIDES, SODIUM ALUMINOSILICATE, ARTIFICIAL FLAVOR, etc) an acceptable alternative.   So instead we were stuck with either a granola bar, a packaged muffin or an orange.  The coffee was horrendous and the only "cream/milk" available was the aforementioned corn syrup solids, etc.   This is fine if you don't advertise you are providing breakfast - hence my review. To let folks know what to really expect - snacks.   Oh, and another tip -- if you want a cup in room -
Manager Response: We appreciate you being our guest and providing your feedback.  We know how important it is to start your day off right with a good breakfast, so we are sorry our selections at our complimentary grab-and-go breakfast didn't live up to your expectations.  We will certainly pass along your feedback to the appropriate team regarding food and beverage selections at our hotel.  Thank you again for your feedback, and we look forward to welcoming you back soon.    Sincerely, General Manager

Summary: Went to Disney from here as I'm sure many guests do. It's also right next to a delicious food precinct including Cheesecake Factory, so who can complain at that. As far as Extended Stays go, this one was fine (we stayed in a few across the US on our travels). Rooms were clean, breakfast was good and staff were polite and helpful. Cheers
Manager Response: Thank you for being our guest at Extended Stay America - Orange County - Anaheim Convention Center. We are happy that you liked your clean suite, the breakfast we served and our helpful staff. We receive many positive comments about our location, so we are glad this contributed to making your stay a great one. Thanks again, and we hope you will plan on staying with us again in the future.    Sincerely, General Manager

Summary: I'm staying while moving.  The grounds are clean, well kept and quiet.  Rooms clean.  Linen crisp and clean.  Entire staff friendly, helpful, always smiling, trying their best to make ones stay memorable.
Manager Response: Thanks for posting a review, so future travelers can read about your pleasant experience here at Extended Stay America - Orange County - Anaheim Convention Center. It's so nice to hear how much you enjoyed your stay, and we are happy you were impressed with our service, immaculate suites and amenities. Thank you for being our guest, and we look forward to your next visit.    Sincerely, General Manager

Summary: ESA Orange County was an excellent choice.  The accommodations were nice, the staff was friendly, and they had a shuttle to Disneyland for half the cost of parking (at Disneyland).  Rooms were clean, and family friendly.  In addition, I arrived early to see if I can leave my car in their parking lot (so we can go to Disneyland and not have to pay for parking) and the staff (not only) checked me in early but educated me on the shuttle service.  Both staff members saw that I had a coupon and they both shared w/ me that it would be applied at the end (which was nice and reassuring).  One last thing... While their rooms have kitchenettes, you need to ask for utensils and appliances.  I didn't know that and would have like to have utensils.
Manager Response: Thank you for being our guest and for taking the time to review your experience at Extended Stay America - Orange County - Anaheim Convention Center. It is wonderful to read you not only enjoyed our excellent service and convenient location, but you also found us to be a great value and that you were impressed with our shuttle service as well. We are also glad you enjoyed your suite offering apartment style living with lots of room to relax, and many extras that make traveling easy. We truly appreciate you sharing your thoughts and hope to see you again soon.     Sincerely, General Manager

Summary: Visited during the Expo west convention in March and stayed for 5 nights. This hotel does room service only once in 7 days. So if you are trying to plan a 2-3 day stay beware. the breakfast is too bad and just coffee with some fruit or muffin. I was staying on third floor and the grill was not fixed. I tried to get it fixed by calling the reception but was told to bare with it. Had to call thrice to get fresh bath towels. Finally got fed up and left a day before to my friend's house in Orange County. My booking was prepaid so obviously no refund.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I had a hard time sleeping , people upstairs were stomping so hard I could hear everything move. It was the worst nights. I would never stay or recommend anyone to stay there. There was no gym I spent three horrible nights the floors were squeaking while the people upstairs were stomping so hard I couldn't even get a refund so I had to tolerate the noise. I traveled 5 hours from New York I was exhausted so the whole three nights I was nothing but exhausted.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Affordable stay for our 2 day Disneyland visit. Overall we were pleased with our stay and would stay there again especially since it was close to Disneyland main entrance and affordable.  - free parking - kitchenette: you would have to bring your utensils, pots, plates etc or ask front desk for items since there is nothing stocked in the rooms kitchenette. - 2 desks and tv - iron and iron board inside closet of room - bathroom clean however if you need extra towel or more toilet paper you would need to go to front desk to replenish Free breakfast called "grab and go" which contained coffee, tea, hot chocolate, granola bars, muffins and fruits. This is located right In front reception desk and ends at 9:30a. I can't remember the start time but provided daily.  Location: cross
Manager Response: Thank you so much for posting a review of our property.  It’s great to read that we were able to accommodate your needs with all of our convenient amenities as well as our location.  I’m thrilled that you found our hotel to be a good value!  The staff and I would like to thank you again for posting your review.  We look forward to welcoming you back in the future!

Summary: Had a parking issue elsewhere because we were driving a small motorhome and Extended Stay cheerfully accomodated us. They have a roomy well lighted parking lot with access near the resort shuttle for Disney.
Manager Response: I want to thank you for taking the time to post a review of your stay.  I truly appreciate your comments regarding our accommodating customer service and am glad you had a positive experience.  Once more, thank you for posting your review.  We look forward to having you visit with us again in the future.

Summary: Stains on bed and couch. Looked like boogers on tissue. Hora ble mattress on pullout springs picking through mattress  kids could not sleep only 2 blankets in entire hotel. When complaint made out of blue receive a wake up call at 4 AM not authorised.  I would suggest no matter the cost stay away
Manager Response: I appreciate you taking the time to write a review of your experience with us.  Please accept our apologies for the room conditions you experienced.  To uphold our company’s high standards, I will be reviewing our cleaning and room inspection procedures with our staff.  Thanks to your feedback, we can continue to work on providing an exceptional stay for all of our guests.  Please contact me, at acc@extendedstay.com, if you would like to discuss this further.  We hope that you will give us the opportunity to provide you with a better experience the next time you're in the area.

Summary: Big rooms including full kitchen, but not cleanest or most comfortable.  Room not ready at check in, shower broken, but very convenient to Honda centre - location redeeming value - free car parking. Close to range of food options. Bedding either 2 doubles or King so have to book 2 rooms for families
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience with us.  I sincerely apologize for the room conditions you experienced.  To uphold our company’s high standards, I will make sure we are thoroughly inspecting rooms prior to guest arrivals.  I really appreciate you bringing this to our attention.  If you would like to discuss this further, please do not hesitate to contact me at acc@extendedstay.com.  We would love to have another chance to provide you with a better experience at our hotel the next time you're in town.

Summary: Easy to get to, and reasonably within walking distance to Disneyland, paid about 100 dollars a night for what is like an apartment, full kitchen, executive-like pleasing room. Stayed twice, multiple days.  The " breakfast is more like snack on way out: apples/fruit, granola bars, coffee, add a few small hot water based things, but, free.  Close to, walking distance, to a Denny's and IHOP. A 7 dollar taxi ride to the Disney gate, or 7 minute walk. A shuttle, of some type, not very helpful if wanting to head out, is a multi-hotel, route thing, I never took.  Staff was great, on site laundry.  Clean, professional.  The full kitchen, and etc., style room, more than we needed, for a few days, but, having such a nice fridge, at such a nice price, was refreshing.  Other hotels in the
Manager Response: It is so rewarding to read that you had a wonderful stay with us.  Thank you for your comments.  I'm thrilled that you enjoyed our convenient location, fully equipped kitchens and comfortable accommodations.  I truly appreciate your kind comments regarding our friendly customer service.  Once more, thank you for posting your review.  We look forward to having you visit with us again in the future.

Summary: Just got back from a week at Disneyland. I have to agree with other comments. Staff was really great and accommodating. However the hotel does need to get some renovations. The walls here seem paper thin, you can hear conversations or toilets flushing from every direction. The beds were ok but not great, the pillows were hard and not comfortable. They serve coffee, tea, muffins, fruit, cocoa, granola bars for breakfast. I know the coffee is free but they can do better. Overall it was not a bad stay.
Manager Response: I appreciate you taking the time to write a review of your recent stay.  Please accept our apologies that we were unable to exceed your expectations.  Still, I am glad we were able to provide you with a satisfactory stay and friendly customer service.  Thank you again for sharing your experience with us.  We would love to see you again, should your travels bring you back to our area.

Summary: My husband and I just got back from our trip and we loved our stay! Check in was a breeze, we got a corner room that had an extra window. The room was very clean and had a kitchen with full size fridge and stove top. The kitchen does not have supplies but the front desk had everything we needed and they were always so kind. Sure, i could sit here and nit pick small issues like scratches in the paint but for seven nights it was extremely cheap! Free parking and we even could walk to Disney in ten minutes! We also had a view of the Disney fireworks! We will definitely be staying here next year!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for posting a review of our property.  I’m so pleased to read that you had a great stay at our hotel!  I truly appreciate your kind comments regarding our convenient location, friendly staff and reasonable rates.  Once more, thank you for posting your review.  We look forward to having you visit with us again in the future.

Summary Heading: Good place to stay for the price!
Summary: I'm so glad for travelers previous reviews on this hotel! I came prepared! After a long 6 hour drive, we checked in at 7:15pm. The lady at the front desk was very sweet and accommodating. We had reserved a queen bed room and she upgraded us to a 2 queen bed room and to a room where we could see the Disneyland Fireworks.   We did have to ask for the dishes and coffeemaker as they were not in the room when we checked in. There is also no hairdryer.   Everything in the room worked great, fridge, stove, tv, ac. The free breakfast they had downstairs consist of fruit, muffins, granola bars, and coffee.   You can ride the Art shuttle bus to Disneyland for $5/a person round trip. The shuttle bus picks you up in the hotel parking lot.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I did like may stay in this Extended Stay. it is right around the corner of Disney a Cheesecake Factory is across the street, unfortunately the mall just a few meters away does not have a lot to offer. It seems not many people visit the mal and thus not many stores are open ... Coming back to the Extended stay. You get a usual continental breakfast, with apples, some candy bars and muffins as well as coffee. Nothing special, but also nothing to complain about.  The room I got was on the ground floor, I had a look towards the pool.  It seems that the parking lot behind the building is used by some dubious people for doing their "business". During may stay I saw at least twice such a situation.  I know this is not the Extended Stays fault, still I wanted to mention it. For people
Manager Response: Thank you so much for sharing your experience with us.  I appreciate you letting us know about the issues you experienced.  In response to your feedback, I will make sure we are walking the property frequently to prevent this from happening again.  Still, I am glad to read that you had a positive stay overall and enjoyed our convenient location.  The staff and I would like to thank you again for posting your review.  We look forward to welcoming you back in the future!

Summary: Well it served the purpose but that's about all I can say about this place.  Things really need some updating.  The housekeeping was sad as there were several hairs in the bathroom sink, the tub and in the clean towels.  The bottom of the tub had something like ground in dirt.  Not very appealing.  But everything worked.  A nice TV that even had a channel guide which was nice for a change.  The price was OK so I'll probably be back here the next time I need to work in the area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I appreciate the price and the fact that you get a real refrigerator, but this place does need some work. They tout the kitchenette, but NOTHING is in your room.  You must request dishes, utensils, cups, even dish soap.  We waited probably 2 hours for them to supply the items we asked for.  As noted, there is only one desk person, so it all falls to them to fulfill requests.  After a few days, we asked for fresh towels and more tissues (there had been 1/2 a box in the bathroom).  We were told the tissues were "complimentary upon check in" and they "couldn't guarantee" we could have more!  We eventually received a bag with towels and the woman said she had found the tissues, but there were none in the bag! (She found them, but we couldn't have them?)  The breakfast is coffee,
Manager Response: I received a copy of your review, and wanted to take a moment to personally respond.  Please accept our apologies that our amenities were not to your expectations.  In response to your feedback, I will make sure we are clearly communicating our amenities during guest arrivals.  Additionally, I will make sure we are thoroughly inspecting rooms to ensure that everything is functioning properly and responding to guest needs in a timely manner.  Your feedback is very important to us, so thank you for sharing.  Thank you for choosing Extended Stay Hotels. We hope we have the opportunity to see you again in the future.

Summary: My wife and I ran out to Disneyland for 5 days the week of Oct 17 - 21st. First you always expect Disneyland to be busy but we found out Sat. When we went to the park Southern California schools was on a fall break, so Disneyland only had elbow room, rides were up to 2 hours in line and if you didn't get your Fast pass in the morning that they were probably all gone. We had Hopper passes so we went over to California Adventure and it was packed. So we started out first thing in the morning and grabbing our Fast passes. We rode ART to Disneyland both ways, you could walk but we preferred to ride. ART was $12. for 3 days, $5. a day. The hotel staff was very outgoing and helpful. We had a King suite with kitchen and it larger than most we have stayed in before and very quite. The
Manager Response: Thank you so much for posting a review of our property.  I’m so pleased to read that you had a great stay at our hotel!  I truly appreciate your kind comments regarding our convenient location, friendly staff and our comfortable rooms.  Thank you again for posting your review.  I do hope that you will return to our hotel, or any of our other brand locations, in the future.

Summary: This hotel needs major renovating, the foyer looks very inviting, the rooms smell horrible permanent residents have arguments in the hall ways at 3-4 in the morning, carpets are stained and sticky, shower leaks, water is Luke warm.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I had such a nice quiet clean room with comfy beds and a great time swimming in the clean refreshing pool! :) I was sooooooooooo close to the Disneyland resort hotel (where my business convention was being held) and I saved so much money staying at this hotel!! and the staff was sooooooooo kind and helpful too!!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for sharing your experience with us.  I’m thrilled that we were able to provide you with a home away from home experience and that you enjoyed all the amenities our hotel has to offer!  Once more, thank you again for your kind words.  The staff and I would love to provide you with another comfortable stay in the future.

Summary: I read several mixed reviews about this Extended Stay but decided to trust the few good reviews. I'm glad I did! I was quite happy with our stay here. We got into town very early and they let us check in early, no fees. I had a queen kitchenette room on the first floor and was very happy with it. It was clean, fresh, quiet and perfect for my niece and I.  I had read someone complained about no daily towel service but it is an extended stay, they do the room once a week. Towels ARE available at the front desk whenever you need it.  We don't care about hotel breakfast too much, that's not why I'm there. Yes, it was instant oatmeal and packaged muffins but there is a kitchen in your room. They will provide all you need to fix something. Did I mention free wifi? The front desk staff
Manager Response: Thank you so much for posting a review of our property.  I’m so pleased to read that you had a great stay at our hotel!  I truly appreciate your kind comments regarding our convenient location, friendly staff and comfortable rooms.  Once more, thank you for posting your review.  We look forward to having you visit with us again in the future.

Summary: Decent location about 3 miles from Disneyland at lower rates than the hotels near the park.  Forget the "breakfast."  I was charged $5.00 extra per night for the breakfast which was just coffee, tea, unbelievably gooey muffins (probably under baked) some instant oatmeal, peanut power bars and some apples.  It was served at a coffee station in the lobby, and frankly anyone could take the food, paid for or not.  There was no signage that it was an extra.  It was not worth it even if it was free.  Do not pay for it when you book.    The staff was friendly.  The room was big with a full kitchen but nothing in it to cook with or eat with.  There is no maid service; you make your own bed and if you need clean towels you go to the front desk with your dirty ones although the plastic

Summary: Nice place to stay. Helpful staff members are there to guide & take care. ART( Anaheim Resort Transportation) buses are available @$5 per person per day  from the parking lot of the hotel to go to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your stay.  I am glad to read that you were pleased with your stay and our convenient amenities.  I truly appreciate your comments regarding our friendly customer service.  Thank you again for posting your review.  I do hope that you will return to our hotel, or any of our other brand locations, in the future.

Summary: Stayed in this hotel for 3 days the staff were very helpful and friendly, had great facilities such as laundrette and was very close to DisneyLand which was very handy. The hotel location is 1hr away from the City of Angels (LA) which isn't too bad but I would not recommend booking this specific hotel if you plan on getting to downtown LA regularly...   The hotel room was okay, clean but it did have a weird and unplesent smell and noise which we complained about, staff offered to move us but we left it as it was.   Parking is great and free which is amazing if you have a car and want to either park it overnight or just park it all day while you go do your own thing!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your stay.  I appreciate your comments regarding our friendly staff and convenient location; however, I apologize for the odor issues you experienced.  In response to your feedback, I will make sure we are thoroughly inspecting rooms moving forward.  Thank you again for posting your review.  I do hope that you will return to our hotel, or any of our other brand locations, in the future.

Summary: The room smelled of fried fish.  The pillows smelled.  Bought a can of Febreze to attack it.  Stovetop burner was missing a drip pan:  big build-up of smelly grease underneath.  Those black hairs on the pillow and sheets were not from anyone in my family:  all blonds or gray.  Those sunflower seed shells on the floor were not ours.  Should've taken the cans and bottles to recycling.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: After 5 mo. extended stay, I am happy.
Summary: We had 5 months long extended stay here and overall experience was good. Girls on the desk are friendly and capable and they have attitude to solve all your problems. Poll has been build without restrooms which is bizarre, flat screen in your room is still on SD antenna and "kitchen" is something without oven but on the end of the day this is the people who makes you feel at home and this is the best experience I had in hotel for years. Yes, I will recommend this place to my friends.
Manager Response: I appreciate you taking the time to write such a wonderful review.  I truly appreciate your kind comments regarding our friendly and accommodating staff.  I’m thrilled we were able to provide you with a home away from home experience!  Thank you again for sharing your experience with us.  We would love to see you again, should your travels bring you back to our area.

Summary: Rooms are decent. Expected full set of kitchen utensils.. non-stick utensils not available. Breakfast is a limited edition.. not much range of cereals.. taps were leaky.. shud have taken care..Front desk very helpful in quick check-in, checkout, flexible in change of plans.. If looking for a budget hotel near to Disneyland with ART bus stops nearby, can go for it
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words about our front desk staff and your suggestions for how we can improve.  We rely on feedback from our guests as we make changes to our amenities and services.  I would love to provide you with another comfortable stay in the future. Thanks again for choosing Extended Stay America!

Summary Heading: Overall I don't like this place
Summary: Hotel is not very clean.Whenever I called reception no one answered carpet, bed sheets, bed  were very dirty.I took this place because i just wanted to get a hotel with kitchen. This is more or less like a motel than a hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: As an annual pass holder for the past 4 years I’ve stayed at a few properties in and around Disneyland and this remains one of my favorite hotels to stay. The rooms are updated and comfortable, and having a kitchenette is great! I saved costs by making breakfast and lunch one day! In comparison to our last stay here though there are some things that could use attention: Upon check in, the first room we were given had hair all over the bathroom. On the shower curtain, in the tub and on the towels. How does that happen? The refrigerator was leaking onto the floor and I swear that was the tiniest queen bed I have seen, it was very small. But when I notified the front desk, we were immediately given a different room so there was no hassle there, but an offer for an upgrade or other
Manager Response: none

Summary: I like having an apartment type hotel when our family visits Disneyland.  A full size refrigerator and stove/microwave and the morning coffee freshly brewed.  Fresh juice and milk or a cold beer at a fraction of the restaurant costs are a nice thing to have or cold sodas.  Extra snacks are handy and can be brought with you on check in and even when we eat out, we can bring back packaged things and heat them up easily to eat later.  Only a short walk is a convenience store with almost anything you'd want including ice cream; and basic necessities in case you forgot anything at home.  The kitchen utensils, dishes are welcome and we all have a much more relaxed visit at our own lifestyle and pace.  Free WIFI and easy to use HD TV; what else would you want?   As long as you are
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here 2 yrs ago for a week, AWSOME time and came back this week, again wonderful staff, clean room, anything we have needed or wanted all staff make it happen. Keep up the good work and we will be back again!!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your stay.  I am thrilled you had a great stay at our hotel! I truly appreciate your comments regarding our friendly staff and comfortable rooms.  Thank you for choosing Extended Stay Hotels.  We hope we have the opportunity to see you again in the future.

Summary Heading: "We're not like any hotel you've ever stayed at"
Summary: We stayed here for two nights 04/24/15 - 04/25/15 while visiting Disneyland.  When checking in,  the front desk clerk told us "We're unlike any hotel you've ever stayed at." After hearing that we expected something awesome.  Instead she advised us that they don't have housekeeping so if we need towels or other items we would need to come down and get them.  When we got to out room we immediately noticed that there was no coffee maker and hair dryer.  This is an extended stay and there were no dishes,  silverware,  glasses,  etc.  Having stayed at Extended Stays in the past we have always had a full stock of kitchenware.  If you're looking for service,  don't book here.  The staff rarely can be found at the front desk and was told that after 5pm there is just one or two employees
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had such a pleasant and restful experience. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Check- in was a breeze. The rooms were very clean and nicely upgraded. Although it was a pet friendly hotel, the rooms were clean, did not smell of any pet odors and it was really quiet. We did not hear any barking. The location was so convenient...it was right across the Garden Walk and about a 15 minute walk to Disneyland. We will be staying here from now on!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your stay.  I'm so pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and that you had an easy check-in.  I’m thrilled our staff was able to provide you with great service and that our location was convenient.  Once more, thank you for posting your review.  We look forward to having you visit with us again in the future.

Summary: My daughters and I love to watch Red Wing hockey so we bought tickets to see them play the Ducks of Anaheim at the Honda Center.  We were looking for a room nearby since the three of us come from different directions, we needed someplace to call home for the night.  I came upon Extended Stay America and was able to get a room at a great price.  I then found out it had only one queen size bed in it.  I asked at the desk and they upgraded me to 2 queen size beds at no additional charge.  The room was clean, the beds were comfortable, and the location was in the middle of everything Anaheim has to offer.  We did not take advantage of the kitchenette that was in the room but next time we stay there we will be more prepared.  The people I spoke with at the hotel were very friendly
Manager Response: Thank you so much for sharing your experience with us.  I am so glad to hear our staff was able to make your stay comfortable and enjoyable.  I’m also thrilled to read that you found our hotel to be a great value.  Once more, thank you for posting your review.  We look forward to having you visit with us again in the future.

Summary: No housekeeping !!! Dead phones !! No extra comforters when requested !!! No proper breakfast !!! Just to go items very very few choices  had a hard time with Mr. Adrian.at this location  He is very political trying to hide from the situation     Manager told me you will take care of the situation   This was ridiculous.   He told me you will get the housekeeping done and call priceline to refund some money as management was terrible and no one is responsible. They keep pointing  other co-workers for not giving you basic things that's required to stay   I have learnt a lesson.  complete a rip off and very bad management in here. Please stay somewhere else
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for 10 days during a family trip. The room was clean and the staff were friendly. We were impressed with our stay, especially considering the price. The shuttle to Disneyland was fantastic for our young children although the park is close enough to walk. The pool is small but was perfect for our needs.  This hotel is upfront on the website about cleaning (weekly) and amenities. I would stay here and have recommended it to friends.
Manager Response: Hi Stephanie,   Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your stay.  We are pleased to read your kind review of our hotel.  I am grateful for the feedback you provided so we are able to continually improve.  If you have any additional feedback, please reach out to me at acc2@extendedstay.com.  Thank you for choosing Extended Stay America. We hope we have the opportunity to see you again in the future.!

Summary: I would like to thank Caroline and her staff for providing excellent accommodation and service to me and my cat. Anything I've needed is promptly provided with a smile. And ALL services and provisions are appropriate for this price range. If you want to bring the kids and the dog cook your own meals and stay near Disneyland, Knott's Berry Farm, Queen Mary, Aquarium Of The Pacific, Honda Center, Angel Stadium, Anaheim Convention Center, walk to The Cheesecake Factory, PF Chang’s, Bubba Gump’s and so on all for a budget rate then Extended Stay America Anaheim Convention Center Orange County is a great choice!
Manager Response: Paul - The staff and I read your review, and would like to thank you for writing such wonderful things about your stay.  I'm so pleased to hear that you had a fantastic experience here with us.  We appreciate for your kind words.  We would love to provide you with another comfortable stay in the future.

Summary: WORST !! WORST !! WORST !! Extended Stay I have stayed at till now..... I have stayed at ESA hotels multiple times, different places...All of my stays have been Wonderful and I always book ESA without even thinking about other hotels..  But stay at ESA Anaheim has changes my opinion...I will have to be very careful about booking stay at ESA going ahead... When I reached hotel on Friday, the front desk person was new and did not know some stuff...  I asked for Shaving foam and blade...I was told they only have blade and do not provide Shaving foam...What? There were not utensils/ coffee maker/ hair dryer.. in the room...I had to ask everything and I had to wait 45 minutes to get those.. The one they gave me were poor quality... The knife had rust on it.. The utensils were not
Manager Response: none

Summary: I arrived to the hotel early in the morning (way too early) The desk clerk checked me in, took care of my bag and set me up with parking. I went to the convention I was in town for, and when I got to my room, my bag was waiting for me safe and sound. I have stayed with Extended stay at many locations and it's always just right.....
Manager Response: none

Summary: No staff to be found, so best of luck getting utensils or anything to make use of the kitchen...couldn't even get ashtrays for our smoking room.  Was blood stains on one of our pillows.  "Grab and go breakfast" consists of granola bars, coffee, and fruit...which is fine, but the lack of staff presence in the lobby resulted in one Asian family loading the entire thing into their pack every morning.  Stayed on 4th floor and there's a hallway door by the elevator that slams every time someone comes or goes, so we averaged a good 3 hours of sleep a night.   No hairdryer, which upset the missus, and no fan or ventilation in the bathroom.  Overwhelming smell if marijuana in the hallway, homeless people in the lobby, this hotel has it all!  Bring the kids!
Manager Response: I received a copy of your review and wanted to take a moment to personally respond.  I am so disappointed that your stay was not comfortable.  Please accept my apology. To discuss further, or if you have any questions, please contact me at acc@extendedstay.com.  We hope that you will give us the opportunity to provide you with a better stay the next time you're in the area.

Summary: We reserved a room a week ahead, when we got there they told us there was no reservation made for us. The girl at the front desk said they had 5 other rooms but nothing under our name. Instead of offering us one of those rooms she said to check back in a couple of hours. We did and still nothing. We waited in the lobby with all our stuff for a room to be cleaned. They gave us a handicap accessible room, it was horrible. We've stayed in their other regular rooms and those are kept up with, these rooms felt run down. The sheets were torn with stains, the curtains also. We found hair&a spider in the sheets. The shower had a bench I couldn't manage myself around to stand comfortably.I felt bad for those who stay in these rooms regularly. The feel of it was very different, not a

As well, I am sorry that your room had cleanliness issues.  I will be having my housekeeping staff deep clean this room specifically to prevent this from happening again. Summary: Compliments to you for your wonderful staff at Extended Stay Anaheim Convention Center. Your excellent new General Manager Carolyn Tanuvasa has made an amazing difference and the improvements are fantastic - the changes are very obvious – all the systems have been tightened up and the hotel runs very smoothly. Carolyn is so efficient and on the ball and any request is handled promptly – she is a true asset to your company.   Carolyn, as well as her Assistant Manager, Gigi are amazing people and they, together with their staff, have made my stay here so very pleasant with their warmth, friendliness, and their caring and helpful attitudes, as well as their professionalism. They should be commended on a job well done!  Fabulous customer service all round!  Kind Regards Tony
Manager Response: The team and I read your review and would like to thank you for writing such wonderful things about us and your stay.  It's great to hear that we provided a home away from home for you.  Thank you again for your kind words.  The team and I would love to provide you with another comfortable stay in the future.

Summary: I really enjoy my stay was so close everything , special in frontdesk they have the city map is was very helpful very close to disneyland, is clean but not fancy, my family and i save money because the kitchen. I will stay again.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for posting a review of our property.  It's great to hear that you appreciated the proximity of our hotel to Disneyland.  As well, I am thrilled to know that my staff was so helpful and accommodating.  Once more, thank you for posting your review.  We look forward to having you visit with us again in the future.

Summary: Don't expect a complete hotel room when you stay here. They don't do housekeeping while you are there. I'm pretty sure they didnt even clean the room before we checked in. Floors were filthy. Sheets looked dirty. NOTHING in room. And I mean nothing. No dishes, kitchen items, hair dryer. You have to ask for it all. Hot water didnt work in our room. We had a 2nd room and the a/c didnt work in that one. We called and they didnt send anyone to fix. Maintenance only works 10am-5pm. After hours you cant even call the front desk. It goes straight to a recording with someone named Molly who we never saw. Completely ridiculous!!  I dont care how cheap the room is, I would NEVER stay here again! I travel all across the country with kids and without several times a year and I've never
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: this not the place for your kids: lots and lots of bugs
Summary: Where to start.  I understand with the price I paid, there are things that I would have to deal with.  But after checking In on the first day, my son started receiving bug bites after the first night.  I went to the front desk to get the room changed, but the new room was not any better.  My son received 10 more bites.  Then i started getting bites too.  I mentioned to the desk about a bug problem, and they said there were no bugs.  No room will be safe from any bugs because I had to switch so many times to another room.  I even had ant problems in another room. Everything else was fine, but there is no way I can stay at this place because I felt it was more of a hassle to deal with this discomfort.    Expect at most credit to get your clothes washed. Not worth to stay at.
Manager Response: none

Summary: No hair dryers, no sponge for kitchen, no paper towels, no corkscrew in entire hotel.  You have to ask for dishes, coffee makers, etc. and they weren't clean.  Had to use the heater to semi dry my hair.  Tub not clean. No ice machine in hotel.  Amenities are almost nonexistent.  Breakfast runs out and is not restocked.  Towels very thin and need replacement.  On a positive note, front desk staff is friendly.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This Hotel was so dirty, when we checked in we were given a room and went there and the first thing coming out of the elevator the smell of cigarette smoke was overwhelming.  We went in to our room and it smelled very musty.  The bathroom was very dirty toilet had not been cleaned at all it looked like a dirty gas station bathroom.  The shower had stains and hairs in it the bedding was very stained.  I went back to the lobby and told them of the dirty room and they gave me a different room.  It was better but still not good.  The bed spread had blood stains on it and this room had no toilet paper at all.  I had to go ask house keeping for T.P..  They do not clean your room unless you are there more than a week.  The pool is very small.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: This Place Will Make You Appreciate Home a Lot More
Summary: I have been staying in this hotel for an extended period (over a month), so I think I have a pretty good feel for the property.    The beds are terrible, but I have purchased a bed topper and made it work.    Once a week house-keeping is a misnomer as it is one of the poorer cleaning jobs that I have ever seen in a hotel, especially for once a week (toilet paper does not get re-stocked at least half the time!!).   Staff is generally fine, though I don't ask much of them.  There are no work-out facilities and a small pool with no Jacuzzi.    Furnishings are generally in poor shape (particularly my dresser and my lounge chair) but t.v is nice.  As a non smoker,  I stay in a non smoking floor on the fourth floor (which is a smoking floor) and this may bother some travelers as the

I will be working with my housekeeping team to review our cleanliness standards to ensure that your experience is not repeated.  As well, I do apologize that our grab-and-go breakfast was not properly re-stocked during your stay with us.  I have met with my front desk staff to ensure that re-stocking breakfast items is a priority for them.  I also regret to hear that our amenities and service overall did not meet your expectations.
