We hope that you will give us the opportunity to provide you with a better stay the next time you're in the area.

Summary Heading: We enjoyed the serene environment and the staffs were excellent
Summary: We had almost 16hrs flight from our country to Anaheim, it was very comforting when we were told that despite the fact that check in time was 3pm but since the previous occupants had checked out earlier, the room was quickly prepared for us to refresh ourselves before going out to purchase groceries. The employees were friendly especially Gigi who was exceptional during our stay. Our kids got to know her name and enjoyed the several support we got from her.   It was a stone throw from Disneyland, the parking lot was spacious enough to always find parking space when retiring for the day.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for sharing your experience with us.  I am glad to read that you were pleased with the vicinity from the park and that your stay was comfortable.  Thank you again for your kind words.  The staff and I would love to provide you with another comfortable stay in the future.

Summary: I would recommend people to stay as far away from this hotel chain as possible this particular hotel pedophile owner of curry upon entering they cannot provide enough hair dryers for the entire hotel you will be put on a waiting list and still will never receive it except for one person the staff is extremely rude and not thoughtful at all.
Manager Response: The staff and I read your comments about your stay with us.  The situation you described regarding hairdryers being unavailable is truly regrettable.  We are very sorry for your experience.  I discussed your comments with the team, and will be working to expand our inventory to ensure that we have enough hairdryers to provide to guests.  Your feedback is very important to us, so thank you for sharing.  To discuss further or if you have any questions, please contact me at acc@extendedstay.com.  We would love to have another chance to provide you with a better experience the next time you're in town.

Summary: I Booked non smoking room. but i got smoking with lot of smoking smell. i asked front desk, i shocked with their response. your room type is not guaranteed. that is based on first come first serve basis.   I am not sure what is the need of advance reservation?
Manager Response: The feedback provided in your review is much appreciated.  Please know that we are sincerely sorry that we were not able to provide a non-smoking room as requested.  To uphold our company's high standards, we will be reviewing our reservation and check-in policy moving forward.  The staff and I appreciate your comments, as it will only help us to improve.  I hope that you will contact me directly, at acc@extendedstay.com, should you wish to discuss this further.  Thank you for choosing Extended Stay America.  We hope we have the opportunity to see you again in the future.

Summary: If you have no more rooms please say so .end up with with a dirty room is no fun They offer no house keeping Kitchen with no dishes what the point sad .kitchen sink doesn't work dirty fridge pervious guests food sauce leftover management offered to clean the room but at that point wished to check out
Manager Response: Mohamed - Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your stay.  It was disheartening to read that your room was not cleaned properly and that you were not notified of our customizable kitchen packs.  Please accept our apologies.  We store our kitchenware in a sterile environment at the front desk to ensure our guests receive the cleanest items possible.  We will work with our front desk staff to make sure we are fully informing our guests of our available amenities during check-in.  We will also retrain our housekeeping staff to make sure we are thoroughly cleaning every room prior to our guest's arrival.     Thank you again for your review.  We would love to have another chance to provide you with a better experience the next time you're in town.

Summary: Bugs. Roaches and ants everywhere. Room didn't look like it had been cleaned at all. Very disappointed. Tape holding the refrigerator handle. The linen was dirty. The room numbers are hanging off of the doors.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel was clean and comfortable but its a no thrills and bare bones, pool is incredibly small, like they added it just to advertise they have a pool. Breakfast is a joke and should be called a snack, they call it grab and go breakfast but it's just coffee and muffins from costco...quite plain.  And there is no maid service and you have to exchange your own towels, but if your traveling with kids it has a stove and full size fridge and plates and kitchen wares are available so thats good.
Manager Response: We want to thank you for taking the time to post a review of your stay.  It was disheartening to read that our grab-and-go breakfast did not meet your expectations; however, we are so glad to read that you enjoyed your fully equipped kitchen and had a pleasant stay.   Once more, thank you for posting your review.  We look forward to having you visit with us again in the future.

Summary: I booked a room here last minute and chose them based on their reviews, the amenities, and the price. I have food allergies and it's hard to find a decent hotel that has not only a fridge but a microwave as well. We were happy with the facilities and only had a few issues. The first being that the woman we encountered upon arrival was very blunt. We had arrived early, knowingly, due to traveling from out of town and had plans to visit Disneyland for the day. Normally hotels allow you to check in and just give you the key later in the day so that you still get first dibs on a room. She very flatly stated, no check in until 3, it wasn't until we asked if we could at least give her our name, verify our reservation, and notify her of our arrival that she even bothered to check.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Checked in July 19th - July 20th.. Everyone at this hotel was very hospitable. Breakfast to go was exactly what we needed to start the day.  Very clean and on the main path to Disneyland.  First time to Anaheim and the Staff educated me about all Anaheim had to offer including Santa Monica and Huntington Beach.  I have stay at a few Extended Stay America's and by far this one is on the top of my list..
Manager Response: none

Summary: I booked a room here based on the reviews from here.  The front desk person was not friendly at all.  He seems bothered that we showed up to check in.  Once we got in the room, it was ok.  Carpet was stained.  One of the towels had hair on it.  Even the washcloths were frayed at the edges.  Not what you would expect from a hotel that had a good rating.  We left for the afternoon and came back that evening.  Upon arrival our room smelled like sewer.  Something backed up into the kitchenette sink.  There was dirt and bubbles and the smell was horrific.  I called the front desk and it was the same 'friendly' staff person.  He put me on hold for several minutes and said that sorry there is nothing they can do, they are fully booked and can't move us into another room...BUT we can
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hi,  I would like to express how much we enjoyed our stay at this hotel. It was cheap and fairly clean. It was close to every thing and the front desk staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The cleanliness of the room was ok. I would highly recommend this hotel for families.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great stay great place and location , just watch out for the 100 bucks that you will be charged for any damaged or missing items to your card when you get there ! Oh you will get it back if they find no problems ! But five days after or depends on your bank ? Made me feel like I was some sort of a thug or something? Other than that all was great just a bumpy start at the desk about that unforeseen deposit that I got popped with !
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the Extended Stay America for a week for a Disneyland trip. The price is about the most positive thing I can say. There is an ART shuttle that pulls up in the hotel's parking lot, which is nice. I parked outside the hotel and the first thing I noticed was an abandoned vehicle with expired registration parked next to me.  Check-in was slow and the person behind the counter did not have a good understanding of the features of the hotel rooms. We were staying in a suite with a king size bed. There were two adults and two children. We were told there was only a king size bed, that the couch was not a pull-out bed. But, the king size bed was large enough for the four of us. Seriously? For $15 a night, we could rent an additional roll-away bed. The issue was eventually
Manager Response: none

Summary: Do to remodeling at the hotel I was staying out, I was unable to wash clothes.  After explaining the situation, the manager was understanding and allowed me to use their laundry facilities.  This is what I call a Good Neighbor hotel. I would recommend this property in a heartbeat.  Thank you mangement!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here on a short vacation.  Tried to use the pool a couple times and found it dirty.  There was no net to even clean it ourselves.  Very disappointing for the kids when it was in the 90's.  When they cleaned, didn't sweep or vaccum (which left the sand from the beach on the floor) nor did they wipe down the counters.  Bought an ART ticket from the front desk and they sold me a day pass and told me that was the only pass available.  This was incorrect as I could buy single ride tickets from the ART bus which is all I needed, so overpaid.  Staff were very friendly.  Breakfast of instant oatmeal, fruit, muffins, hot chocolate and coffee.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I picked this hotel randomly not expecting much because it was close to where I needed to go, but I ended up loving it! My room was very spacious, had a refrigerator, clean beds/sheets, and extremely comfortable overall.  The person who checked me in was very patient with me and helped me get a better room (I had booked a smoking room by mistake). Her name was Gigi. Thank you very much!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We spent 5 nights here and stayed in a suite.  The checkin was really easy and the room was really nice and spacious.  We have stayed here several times before and the renovations and change in staff have made a very big difference in a positive sense. The location is great for Disneyland and ease of access to major shops and freeways. Be mindful that you don't get a daily linen service but you can request pretty much anything in that regard if you desire it.  The only criticism I have this time is the lack of utensils/cutlery/crockery in the room but again, simply asking at the desk resolved that problem.  The breakfast is 'on the go' and consists of fruit, muesli bars etc and good coffee.
Manager Response: Paul - Thank you so much for sharing your experience with us.  It's great to hear that you enjoyed your spacious room, the customer service you received, and the grab-and-go breakfast.  It was a pleasure having you stay with us and we would love to see you again, should your travels bring you back to our area.

Summary Heading: NEVER AGAIN . . . WAIT, DID I SAY NEVER AGAIN YET?
Summary: I won't waist time.  The receptionist appearance looked like she had just woke up and wore the uniform she slept in. She couldn't answer simple question about the surrounding area.  The entire hallway to our room smelled like smoke.  Our "non-smoking" room smelled like the hallway, an ashtray.  There was several pieces of trash on top of the fridge.  THIS WAS AT CHECK- IN.     At the time of booking, on-line, we paid for house keeping.  Upon returning to our room after a fun day at Disneyland, our room looked like it did when we left in the morning.  I couldn't rate the house keeping because they never showed up.  Judging by the way the room was left when we arrived and what we found when we left, we were better off without.     When we were inspecting the room to check-out, MY
Manager Response: none

Summary: Some of us learn from others experiences, others do it the hard way...well, I have to admit, I did the latter in this particular instance. Imagine walking into a hotel at 11 pm with kids after driving 5 hours, given a room key only to find out that there is ALREADY a guest in that room....!!! To add to the misery, given another room after 15 minutes only to discover that the AC is not working in the room...I guess there is no checking before the room is given.....anyways, on complaining, the 1st response (SARAH was the person on duty) I get is "Sir we will take a look at it first thing in the morning"...really??? Without AC the whole night....how did she have the audacity to even mention it? Anyways, on pushing hard, I FINALLY checked in the room almost at 12:30....!!   DAY2 -
Manager Response: I appreciate you taking the time to write a review of your stay with us.  I apologize that you were initially given an occupied room and that you had issues with your air conditioner.  I will be reviewing your comments with our team to ensure your experience is not repeated.  As well, I am sorry about the situation involving your friends and their moved luggage.  This is unacceptable and we apologize for your experience.  We hope that you will stay at our hotel, or any of our other brand locations in the future.

Summary Heading: Great hotel location, home away from home, great price
Summary: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel from the moment I arrived to the moment I checked out. I liked the location, close to many wonderful shops and restaurants, moments away from Disneyland, and a short shuttle or walk to the convention center. It was great having a nice kitchen space, with a full size fridge to keep those restaurant left overs in and to be able to reheat them in the microwave. They had everything I would ever need on a hotel stay, except a hair dryer, but that's not too big a deal, I will just have to remember next time to pack one.  The staff was very nice, friendly and very helpful. I arrived to the hotel a little early, they let me leave my luggage at the counter while I went out to have some lunch and shop, before returning back at check in time. My only
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed at this hotel for 90+ days while working a project in the area.  The hotel is in nice condition, possibly newly renovated?  The front desk staff was always friendly, especially Gigi.  The Housekeeping Department needs a little work.  The room was clean upon check in, but the weekly cleaning service was not always completed in a timely manner, and when it was done it was only half done.  It's not that the room was filthy, but when you only get 1 service a week, for long term stays, you expect for the bathroom to be cleaned properly, the floors vacuumed and the trash taken out.  If the Hotel can get the Housekeeping up to standard, the place would be hard to beat.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel is clean and has been recently renovated. They advertise some rooms as 1 bedroom when in fact they're studios with a small and low wall that separates the bed from the sofa area. Kitchens are in fact kitchenettes with no oven. We were a family of 4 and the room was prepared for 2, with plates, glasses and silverware just for a couple. Staff was helpful to solve this but only upon request, not very proactive. Although it's close to Disneyland, the actual entrance is a 15 minute walk.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great prices, great employees, worst house keeping
Summary: We arrived early to this property, the Front desk clerk let me do all of the paper work in advance and she told me that she would call me when the room was ready, She even let my family use the rest room to change to cooler clothes, I guess my room was never ready because I never got a call. I returned to the hotel about 3 pm the room was ready.  We were in a hurry to get back to the park so we took our stuff into the room and headed back to the park. We came back to the room at about 12 pm. my wife pulled back the bed spread and said look at this. there was a large spot in the middle of the bed that appeared to be water or something. we pulled back the sheets and there was a large red spot under that on the mattress cover. then I looked at the spread on the back side of the
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Best affordable option with kitchen near Disneyland
Summary: I've stayed here several times when we go to Disneyland and always got a clean and affordable room. If they have availability...book it. When I have company visiting me in California, I like staying here rather than driving home to Pasadena every night after closing, and then back again the next day for California Adventure. Weekly rate is really good if you're sticking around. Location is excellent near Disneyland / California Adventure and also to catch an Angels Baseball game. Safe and clean area with lots of dining options a short drive or walking distance. You can walk to Disneyland. Hope my review helps. Aloha
Manager Response: none

Summary: Do not get sucked in by the photos or other reviews like we did - this hotel may have been recently renovated with new paint and carpet, but that is all they did. The bed, linens and towels are sub-par at best, and the rooms are not clean by anyone's standards. This was one of the dirtiest hotel rooms I've ever stayed in. The ceiling had several large spots that appeared to be ketchup or tomato sauce, even though they were no where near the kitchen. The blanket on the bed had a hair on it when we pulled the comforter off. We could see numerous stains on the pillows and the bed through the linens. The bed creaked and was quite uncomfortable. The walls were paper thin, so we got to listen to the couple in the room on one side of us argue late in to the night and then hear the
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our star at Extended Stay America- Anaheim was fantastic! We were greeted pleasantly when we checked in and out and when we passed through the lobby. Our room was clean and we were able to reheat our takeout from restaurant row on Clementine. We felt safe and relaxed in the hotel. In fact, we have reservations for the Grant Road Extended Stay America in Tucson at the end of May. Thank you for making our trip pleasant and safe. You have new customers!!!
Manager Response: Hi,   Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your stay.  I truly appreciate your comments regarding the service provided by the staff. I am also glad to hear that you felt safe, comfortable and at home while you were with us.  We look forward to welcoming you to Tucson and having you repeat the experience!

Summary: I'm so glad we stayed here because I am VERY picky. We stayed December 2012 & the next December of 2013. Both times were great experiences & it's sad that I see other reviews so didn't. The rooms were clean, the bathrooms were clean& roomy, bed was so comfortable. We had a mini kitchen with fridge. The staff were friendly. We were visiting Disneyland & you can buy a $5 ticket to ride the shuttle from your hotel to the park &back all day. To save on food we bought snacks& water from the hotels vending machine before heading to the park.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience with us.  I truly appreciate your comments regarding our friendly staff and your clean, comfortable room.  It’s great to hear that our location was convenient during your stay.  I’m glad that you were able to take advantage of the shuttle service, your fully equipped kitchen and our vending machines.  We look forward to welcoming you back in the future.

Summary: Rooms are big and comes with the require amenities provided. Fridge in the room is a big plus. Cleanliness can definitely be improved though especially around the kitchen area where we found the dirt and some leftover rubbish.  Breakfast is just some snacks plus hot drinks.  Disneyland and the GardenWalk is within walking distance.  For people on a budget and not asking for too much.
Manager Response: Aves – I want to thank you for taking the time to post a review of your stay.  I am glad that you enjoyed your spacious room and your fully equipped kitchen.  Still, I am sorry to hear that our grab-and-go breakfast and the cleanliness of your room did not meet your expectations.  Your feedback will be useful as we continue to improve our guest experience.    Thank you again for sharing your experience with us.  We would love to see you again, should your travels bring you back to our area.

Summary: We don't have many demands when we stay at a hotel. If it's personal, we stay in our room most of the time and don't want to be bothered or we're out and about as they are conveniently located to both Garden Walk for dining and Disneyland only a block away. If it's business, we bring our own computers, etc. Now as for Extended Stay Anaheim, the rooms were comfortable with a full kitchen (something you're just not going to find anywhere else). Okay, so they don't have much in the way of guest services like you'd get at a $400/night hotel (like Hotel Niko in San Francisco) but the value for the money is beyond compare. If you search online for coupons and make your reservations online you can get even better deals. My only "complaints" were the bathtub plug and faucet handle were
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our hotel.  I am glad that you enjoyed our convenient location, comfortable rooms and your fully equipped kitchen.  Still, I apologize that you encountered some issues with your bathtub plug and faucet handle.  I will have our maintenance staff address these issues so they do not continue in the future.    Thank you again for sharing your experience with us.  We look forward to welcoming you back in the future.

Summary: The biggest plus to this hotel is the friendliness of the staff. Also, the location is good because Disneyland and the Anaheim GardenWalk are both literally right across the street.  However, having 'Anaheim Convention Center' in the title is a little misleading as there are at least a dozen or more hotels closer to the Convention Center than this one. It's probably a good half mile away, so you can count on footing it for a mile round trip unless you drive or take a cab. Parking is free, so that's another plus as many of the closer hotels charge for parking. Really. The rooms were so so, but weren't bad. The bed was very comfortable. If you need clean towels, it's a simple matter of bringing the used ones to the front desk and getting fresh ones. Housekeeping is once a week. I
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of our hotel.  I am glad to hear that you enjoyed our staff and your fully equipped kitchen.  As well, I am happy that you enjoyed our convenient location and free parking.  We look forward to having you visit us again in the future.

Summary Heading: My first stay at Extended Stay America - Orange County - Anaheim Convention Center
Summary: The staff were friendly and the room was clean. Hotel General Manager had given my family and I close attention with hospitality to remember. The morning free coffee was fresh and tasty. The place is in the middle of OC
Manager Response: Sal – I want to thank you for taking the time to post a review of your stay.  I’m glad that you enjoyed our friendly staff and your clean room.  As well, it’s great to hear that our location and coffee met your needs.  It would be our pleasure for you to repeat your experience with us in the future.

Summary Heading: Customer service may be as dead as chivalry
Summary: Since I have stayed at this location before with no trouble, I thought bringing my family with me this time would be a nice and easy stay. I was wrong, so wrong. The trouble started after I made the reservation through the extended stay website via a promotional email giving 20% off a 1-30 day stay; I requested in the comments that someone from the hotel contact me asap to confirm if the hotel provided a fold away crib and a highchair ( I was bringing my infant). No one contacted me after 4 days so I called, and called...and called again. All calls rand through to a central call center that had either poor connection or was unable to understand what i was saying. Frustrated, I chalked it up to a misunderstanding and followed through with going on my trip and getting to the hotel
Manager Response: none

Summary: I just book last minute and was awesome. The room was very good: clean and comfortable. The kitchenette had everything. I didn't know they have kitchen and The grab and go breakfast was a great quick start to our days at Disneyland. And all staff very friendly and very helpful they give you all information about around to area , tips And The walk to the park was about 15 minutes. Hotel is well located to shops, restaurants, like driving 10 min at outlet mall....we will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A Motel 6 in Bakersfield would be better
Summary: We arrived Saturday night with a reservation the lady at the front desk could not find our reservation for about 15 minutes.  After finally finding the reservation she places us in a smoking room. We asked to have it changed and she refused at first saying there were no more rooms Available.  Once again she looked a little and found a room.   The room was pretty nasty:  stains on the sheets, cigarette burns on the blankets, furniture is dirty, room has a weird smell similar to BO, and the window is broken.  My wife and I could not sleep because because you could hear footsteps all night from the floor above.    We were not given shampoo and when asked if we could have some they told us that we would have to come to the front desk for it.  Luckily the hotel is in a good location
Manager Response: none

Summary: The frontdesk service was average. The room was a real let down. The furniture was dusty and dirty. The kitchen sink leaked. The knob to the bathroom was broken. If I had known I was staying for 2 days I would have changed hotels. When I complained to the front desk I was told "Ok". Please dont judge Extended Stay by this review.  I just left the one in Simi Valley, CA and could not have been more pleased. I took pictures and will forward to main office so hopefully they will get things together.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: You pay LESS than what you get
Summary: A very nice place near attractions and lot of food places and grocery stores. Free internet and parking and some breakfast not hot but enough and for what i paid it is more than good.  Best thing was gigi the helpful receptionest.  The place is designed for a long stay with stove and big fridge and a microwave. Cleaning is done weekly not daily and there is no shampoo like other hotels.  It is designed for a family on budget mostly, so if u r solo or couple, i am not sure about ur response. I wad solo without a plan to stay in bed all day so it was fun or at least statisfied my needs.  I may return if i have the same good rate and i am going with a gang of kids :)  Thanks again for the staff
Manager Response: none

Summary: We really enjoyed our 8 night stay here!  The staff were friendly and accomodating.  The room was very good: clean and comfortable. The kitchenette had everything that we could need.  Just sorry we didn't get a chance to try out the pool.  We just ran out of time! The grab and go breakfast was a great quick start to our days at Disneyland.  The walk to the park was about 15 minutes.  Hotel is well located to shops, restaurants, etc.  And you can't beat the price!  If you are looking for a 5 star hotel, this isn't it, but it is a family friendly, good value, good quality, budget hotel...we will definitely stay here again on our next trip to Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: if every day was halloween, this is the place to stay
Summary: Business this review is all four letter words, use your imagination.  it was the most horrible stay we have ever booked Dont stay here if you like quiet, freindly staff, getting to sleep, or reasonable prices, this is the worst of the worst places we have ever booked. the remainder of the review is all four letter words, use your imagination.rude,rude,rude! absent of services, abusive of guests, fire in the hotel, no services, staying here makes staying in a concentration camp look like a picnic
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Think Twice Staying at this HOTEL.
Summary: My family and I were on vacation two weeks ago and were suppose to stay at this hotel for 3 days, we only stay ONE.  If you are desperate stay at this hotel.  My wife was so upset with me for choosing this hotel.  The room smell so bad, it was not vacuum, the kitchen was not clean, there were hair and stains on the two beds, and get this there is not room service if you are staying for less than 7 days.  Please consider Residence Inn Anaheim Resort Area/Garden Grove, you pay a little bit but you will be more comfortable, the level of service is outstanding, and the quality of the rooms are amazing.  My wife and kids were happy and that is all it matters to me.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Don't stay here or book through Priceline if you have any requests. Neither one of them care or provide any type of customer service. Additionally, there was NO ICE in the entire hotel. I've never stayed at a hotel that didn't have an ice machine. The room was also Very Dirty and again the front desk people didn't care.(We stayed 7-19-13 for one night only- thank God!) La Quinta is next door and  much better.
Manager Response: none

Summary: When we arrived, everything did not go correctly. We were given smoking rooms which was not great since we were traveling with two kids under 8 years old. I tried to talk to a morning manager, this morning but he or she was not in yet and we were not about to ruin out trip to Disneyland waiting. When I asked about it coming from the the park, they are not able to give our request since they are full. We are staying in the smoking room again and it breaks my heart hearing from my niece of how the room stinks. Dog poops are in the parking lot. Make sure you watch where you are walking. You have to pay for housekeeping. It indicated that they just remodeled, but from the inside when you are in your room, it does not look like they remodeled at all. The lobby looks nice, but that
Manager Response: none

Summary: Just returned from our week stay , 7/12-7/19- First, we picked this hotel for location and price, we visit Disneyland often and want to find a hotel we can return to trip after trip, upon are arrival our first thought was " Great Location" close enough to walk yet far enough away to not have mouse ears walking past your window every 5 sec, we where impressed by the clean landscape, very well kept, upon check in, staff was friendly and helpful , arriving in our room I found the hall ways clean and bright. We booked the small queen and found the space PERFECT for two people (could add a 3rd and still have elbow room) the kitchen was a nice size as well as the bathroom. Room was VERY CLEAN ,I did all my normal checks, bathroom corners, sock test, pull down the bed, under the bed
Manager Response: Cat - It is so rewarding to read that you had an excellent stay with us.  Thank you for your comments.  Please accept our apologies about the parking.  Still, we are delighted to hear that you enjoyed the location, the affordable price, landscaping and the friendliness of the staff.  I am so glad that we were able to provide you with a "home away from home".  Once more, thank you for posting your review.  We look forward to having you visit with us again in the future.

Summary Heading: My stay was better than others apparently; had an awesome stay!
Summary: I stayed during (6/25/13-7/1/13) and my stay was very pleasant. Let me start with the location: location is indeed walking distance to and from Disneyland. A lot of restaurants are located near the hotel as well. It's located in a beautiful, clean area. We didnt see any uncomfortable sites around the neighborhood. Once we arrived at Extended Stay, the hotel gave us a great impression, in terms of stability. When we walk into the hotel to check in, our assistant was very helpful and kind. She gave us our keys and we stayed in the bottom floor almost next to the lobby. Once we walk in our room, we were happy to see what our home would be for the next 5 days. We reserved a queen studio and everything was better than we expected. Our stay was more than what we could've asked for and
Manager Response: Thank you for posting such a wonderful review.   I am glad to read that you were pleased with the location and the surroundings.  Thank you again for your kind words about the great impression the staff provided at check in.  The staff and I would love to provide you with another comfortable stay in the future.

Summary: Stayed here for 4 days in june,fairly modern but lacking so much, housekeeping is done on a weekly basis so each day you've got to ask for towels etc which are not always readily available, after a fun day out its not good to return to room with unmade beds lack of toilet paper etc. Stayed at lots of extended stays and this is never the case, staff friendly enough and helpfull .Could be a winner with some small policy changes,
Manager Response: I appreciate you bringing your experience to our attention.  Please accept our most sincere apologies that our staff did not attend to your needs properly.  Please know, our housekeeping policy includes cleaning once a week for guests staying 8 or more nights at our hotel.  Refreshes and additional cleanings can be purchased as well.  Still, we are more than happy to exchange towels and linens as well as offer additional toiletries at the front desk upon request.  I will work with our staff to ensure we have all items stocked moving forward and that we convey this message at check-in better.   Thanks to your feedback, we can continue to work on providing an exceptional stay for all of our guests.  If you have any additional feedback, we would like to hear it.  Please contact me, at acc@extendedstay.com, so we can speak directly.  We do hope you will choose to stay with us again so we can have the opportunity to provide you with a better experience.

Summary Heading: Should have listened to the poor reviews prior to booking
Summary: I normally go by the reviews from my fellow Trip Advisor travelers on the hotels that I stay in when I take my family on vacation but for some insane reason I went against my gut feeling this time and my family and I were very dissapointed. I really do not like to give a hotel a bad review but I need to do the traveling community a huge favor on this one and share what I liked and disliked about this Hotel. We booked this hotel for our annual Disneyland trip. We thought we would go a little more value oriented this time and try a hotel that had the ammenities to cook and prepare meals. That is one of the only good features of this hotel but after staying there I would rather pay Disneyland prices for food.   Date of stay was June 16, through June 22, 2013  First the good. Vern.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review of your stay.  I truly appreciate your comments regarding the amenities we provide and would like to thank you for writing such wonderful things about one of my employee.  Please accept our most sincere apologies for the dirty bedding, not available at the desk when needed, dirty carpet and tub/shower.  I met with the staff, and we will make sure all rooms have been thoroughly inspected to ensure that these types of issues are not repeated.  The staff and I appreciate your comments, as it will only help us to improve.  I would be happy to speak with you further.  If you would like, please contact me directly, at acc@extendedstay.com.  We hope that you will give us the opportunity to provide you with a better experience the next time you're in the area.

Summary: Smoke filled 4th floor was met with non-urgency rather than standard protocol to ensure occupant safety.  Fire department was not called but the hall was filled with sufficient smoke where you could not see the window at the end of the hall.  The smoke smelled like burnt wires. Occupants were not warned about the problem nor were they advised of what happened or whether it was safe to go back up -- as I left the floor on my own.  Already settling for what was not consistent with what was advertised.  It is unfortunate as this place was conveniently located for someone new to the area and starting a job down the street.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had arrived late Fri 6/14/13, about 10pm. By the time we settled in, it was close to midnight. We had planned on getting up bright/early to get to Disneyland when they opened (8am). We set our alarm to wake us at 5:45am. We got up, turned on the kitchen area's lights and low and behold, cockroaches scurried about! there were only 2 but 2 was enough for us! we killed one of them and the other got away by scurrying behind the stove (maybe an open area/vent back there?). We do not have cockroaches at home and I find them absolutely disgusting! The room itself looked great; we found a frozen Lactaid milk carton sitting in the freezer and a toothbrush/toothpaste tube/mouthwash container behind the 'closet' curtain - i assumed someone left it there before us (did housekeeping not
Manager Response: Your review for our hotel was recently brought to my attention.  I sincerely apologize for the level of cleanliness in your room.  As this hotel’s manager, I can assure you that this is an isolated incident and that I have shared this with my entire team to ensure your experience is not repeated.  As well, I am sorry for our staff's reaction to the incident.  I am going to be coaching them on different ways to provide better customer service moving forward.  I really appreciate you bringing this to our attention.  Please feel free to contact me directly, at acc@extendedstay.com, with any additional comments or questions.  We hope that you will give us the opportunity to provide you with a better stay the next time you're in the area.

Summary: I reserved weeks in advance and called a few days ahead to confirm a very late arrival. Pulling into the parking lot at 4am was later than anticipated, but a relief after a long day and drive...until we got to our room. It was ice cold and apparent the A/C was left on the coldest, highest setting to attempt to combat the most disgusting smell left behind by prior occupants (they acknowledge the ethnic cooking smell but did not appear to do any other odor removal besides the A/C). It was barely tolerable...but my exhaustion superseded my disgust.  I turned on the heat and was subject to a repetitive click. I checked the windows before closing the drapes, and the latches one window (hip level, first floor) were broken and there was no way to lock the window. I was already choosing
Manager Response: none

Summary: Got this deal on Priceline for this hotel and I was very happy with what I received for the price. I had a small kitchen, flat screen tv, and good bed to sleep on for under $50 before tax! Absolutely unbeatable! I will be back.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Many lessons have been learned with the experience I had with the Extended Stay America in Anaheim.  At the last minute, my fiance and I decided to add a day to our vacation.  We needed an inexpensive hotel just for our first night and I booked with the Priceline "Name your own price" tool.  I typically never book less than 3 stars, but just went for the 2.5 star option since it was just one night.  What harm could come of that?  When I looked at the photos of Extended Stay America, I thought... wow, it doesn't look too bad at all!  We arrived to check in around 2pm (check in is not until 3pm, but we were hopeful that we could get into our room early since we had traveled all night and been at the parks all day).  The manager, I believe his name was Jay, notified us that our
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Thought the bad reviews were wrong, until I decided to go to bed.
Summary: I arrived and was checked in right away.  The girl at the front desk was nice. I used their luggage cart, which said Motel 6 on it...I don't know if this used to be Motel 6, but they should probably fix that. Also, no automatic door opening mechanism and I was moving my things in alone so I struggled a lot with the door. This was fine, not a turn off, just annoying.   I got to my room, the hallway smelled rancid, I was praying my room didn't smell. It didn't. It seemed nice. I went to turn on the AC ac it was a bit warm and muggy in the room and at 75 it would not turn on. Hmm...So I went lower.  It FINALLY kicked in at 60. The room is NOT 60, but that is when the AC kicked in. It does not stay on steadily so I am assuming the sensor is broken or something. Again, not of this
Manager Response: The feedback provided in your review is much appreciated. I was disheartened to read that you were not satisfied with the level of cleanliness in your room and our newest feature, the grab-and-go breakfast. Please accept our apologies. I discussed your comments with the team, and I am currently working with our housekeeping staff to ensure all linens are washed properly and rooms cleaned according to our company's high standards.  As well, we will keep your remarks in mind as we continue to improve our morning offerings.   We thank you for giving us the opportunity to speak with you directly about these issues.  As we spoke about, we will be extending you a free night at our hotel or any other brand location. Should you wish to discuss this further, please contact me directly, at acc@extendedstay.com. We would love to have another chance to provide you with a better experience at our hotel the next time you're in town.

Summary Heading: The best customer service you can ask for
Summary: Hi, I stayed at the Extended Stay for well over 2 months while trying to find a place to live. I must say this place was always clean and the customer service is the best I have ever experienced. I liked how the lady came every Tuesday and did an excellent job on my room and Jay took care of my mail all the time and sometimes even called me during the day to tell me the mail came in. I always went out and talked to them about stuff in the area and take out restaurants and they were very helpful. Jay and Angela were the two that stuck out the most in my eyes. Angela was very helpful whenever we needed anything in our room and she always had a big smile on her face. My girlfriend and I would stop in just to say hello to the team at this Hotel. It is very close to Disneyland and
Manager Response: Brandon - Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your stay. We are so happy to hear that the housekeeping team took such great care of you during your 2-month stay.  As well, that the rest of our staff was able to provide great customer service, especially Jay and Angela.  We all truly enjoyed having you stay with us!  Thank you again for your kind words.  The staff and I would love to provide you with another comfortable stay in the future.

Summary: This is definitely a great place to stay.  The staff is very accommodating and very attentive .  The manager on duty at that time " Mr. Jay Kholoma " greeted us with a warm smile and he made us feel like we are at home. A true charm!  I was blown away with the service that Mr. Kholoma provided since it's so rare to find this kind of service anywhere. This is really great experience and I will definitely come back to this hotel.  The Hotel Industry need more people like Mr. Kholoma. Thanks for the excellent customer service!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your stay.  I am glad that you found the staff to be accommodating and attentive, especially Jay.  The entire team strives to provide clean rooms at great rates as well as provide friendly customer service; it is very rewarding to know that we were able to do this for you!  Thank you again for your kind words.  The staff and I would love to provide you with another comfortable stay in the future.

Summary Heading: You Get What You Pay For...
Summary: We arrived one day sooner then anticipated and instead of paying for an extra night at the Hilton we thought the rate was totally great.  Until we checked in... When we arrived I noticed that a Anahiem police car was parked in front, probably a bad sign already.  We threw our stuff in the room and left for Disneyland. When we returned about 1030 pm we saw what a poor job they had done on the room, both from a cleanliness and maintenance perspective.  The bathroom had hair on the sink and the tub and seemed to have old cigarette burns on the sink area. The room smelled like a 1970 motel with old smoke which obviously permiated the paint.  The bedspread was dirty and the blanket was stained. I throw both of them in the corner of the room and told my son not to venture near it. The
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review of your stay.  I sincerely apologize that your stay was unsatisfactory.  As this hotel’s manager, I can assure you that I have discussed each of the issues you experienced with the entire staff and am retraining them on our company's cleanliness policies as well as standards to ensure your experience is not repeated.    We continually work to improve our hotel, so I really appreciate you providing us with your feedback.  I hope that you will contact me directly, at acc@extendedstay.com, should you wish to discuss this further.  We would love to have another chance to provide you with a better experience at our hotel the next time you're in town.

Summary Heading: Home away from home, full kitchen was nice.
Summary: I was greeted warmly and quickly checked into a clean, comfortable room.  The recent renovations are nice, with nice hardwood flooring and brighter decor.  All staff were excellent and genuinely warm and friendly.  The breakfast pastries and coffee were very good.  The pool was small but neat.  Very close to the Anaheim Convention Center so i was able to walk to my show there.  Plenty of great and good restaurants nearby, my favorite being Roy's Hawaiian which was superb.  Anaheim City Walk is right next door and was fun.  Disneyland is about a mile away.  The kitchen in room was a great plus.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your stay.  I am glad to read that you were pleased with your stay with us, especially with clean, comfortable room as well as the grab and go breakfast offerings.    Thank you again for your kind words.  The staff and I would love to provide you with another comfortable stay in the future.

Summary Heading: Found bedbugs on most recent stay!
Summary: I'd love to give this hotel a great review because I've stayed here at least 5 times over the last few months due to traveling for work, and have never had any issues in those stays. Unfortunately, on this most recently occasion this week I woke up to find a bed bug crawling on the sheets. I killed it and immediately called the front desk. The woman that answered was apologetic and said she would send someone up right away. I said to not bother since I was already checking out that morning anyways. This was in room 319. When I checked out, the woman apologized again and offered me 20% off my stay even though I didn't ask. While that was nice of them, I had to call in sick from work that day to immediately drive over an hour home to wash all of my clothes in the hottest water
Manager Response: Molly - Thank you for providing us with details about your stay.  We strive to provide guests with all the comforts of home, so I am disappointed to hear that your room was not clean and the shower was in need of repair.  It has been our pleasure to provide for you during your other stays at our hotel, so I am very sorry that we were unable to do that for you this time. I am working with my team to ensure all of our housekeeping and maintenance standards are being met, now and into the future.    We appreciate the kind comments about the staff; however, we apologize that your stay was not great enough for you to return. Thank you very much for bringing this to our attention.  I invite you to contact me, at acc@extendedstay.com, if you have any additional comments.  I do hope that you will return to our hotel or any of our other brand locations across the U.S. and Canada in the future.

Summary Heading: Really great place to stay in anahiem
Summary: I would definitely stay here again. The staff was super friendly and helpful.. The room was clean and had a really cute kitchenette with everything you would need to make you're own snacks. There is free wifi plus there is a continental breakfast in the morning.. What more could you ask for..
Manager Response: Thank you so much for posting a review of our property.  It's great to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us.  The staff and I would like to thank you again for posting your review.  We look forward to welcoming you back in the future!

Summary: I stayed at this extended stay because of a funeral i had to attend.  Eventhough it was a sad occasion it  was a very comfortable and pleasent stay. The person at the front desk knew why I was in Anaheim and made sure I was checked in rapidly so I could go to my room and rest. I thought that was very kind of him.  The cofffee was great the next morning and again the front desk made sure I had an extra cup before they took it away.  Next time I go to Anaheim, hopefully for pleasure I will stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your stay.  I'm thrilled that you enjoyed the hotel and the convenient area we are located in.  Thank you again for your review.  We look forward to seeing you again, should your travels bring you back to our area.

Summary: I've been working in Southern California for six months, and after an initial stay at Extended Stay in Irvine, I moved to Anaheim.  Right away it was evident that this location was recently remodeled.   While not a definition of luxury, it is definitely clean, functional, comfortable and great value for a long term stay. I've been here for more than 3 months now.   Great location, close to restaurants, freeway access, and within walking distance to Disneyland / California Adventure / Downtown Disney.
Manager Response: It was very kind of you to for take the time to publish such a positive review of your stay at the Extended Stay America Orange County – Anaheim Convention Center. It's always satisfying to read positive feedback from our valued guests, like you. Although some companies run extravagant advertising campaigns for their hotels, we believe that the best kind of marketing is the public praise we get from our millions of happy customers. That's why the biggest investment we make is in our customers. Our company motto is "Excellence Every Day, Every Way", and my promise to you is that we will continue to operate according to this practice; after all, that's how Extended Stay Hotels got to be the largest extended stay lodging brand in North America. It would, of course, be our pleasure for you to repeat your experience with us in the future. Thank you once again, and feel free to reach out to us directly if we can assist you in any of your future travels at acc@extendedstay.com.

Summary: The hotel is convenient for Disneyland/California Adventure.  The local shuttle stops very close but some people walk.  We had electric scooters and found that it was much more convenient to "scoot" to the parks rather than bother with everything the buses go through to get you on with your scooter.  The hotel seems to be working hard to please.  Any maintenance issues we brought to their attention were fixed each day by the time we got back to the room.  The beds were comfortable, the kitchen adequate, the room clean, the staff helpful.  Breakfast is minimal but better than nothing.
Manager Response: I appreciate you taking the time to write such a great and positive review. I'm thrilled that you enjoyed your stay here with us at The Extended Stay America Anaheim Convention Center. Thank you again for sharing your experience with us. We look forward to welcoming you back in the future!

Summary: I really wish our experience was better with this hotel because the price was so great.    I’ll start my review with the positives: Friendly staff – The older gentleman checking us in was very nice and chatty.  The younger gentleman working in the morning restocked the breakfast area for us as it had been picked over.  Both were friendly throughout our stay, conversating with us on occasion about the area and parks. Price – This place was $500 cheaper than our usual hotel during the Spring Break period.  We paid $390 for five nights which included a weekend stay!       Location – I felt safe walking to and from the parks each day with my family.  I would recommend walking all the way down Harbor to Katella and then South Clementine.  Disney Way may be faster, but is not very
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review, and wanted to take a moment to respond.  Our company prides itself on excellent guest service, so it was gratifying to read your feedback about our staff.  I would like to give you my most heartfelt apology regarding the part of your stay that was not satisfactory. As this hotel’s manager, I challenge our staff to continually improve the experience of our guests, from the cleanliness of our rooms, to the courteous professionalism of our staff.  Unfortunately, in your situation, it is clear that we were unsuccessful in achieving these goals.  Given our belief that guests like you are our most valuable asset, this failure is particularly troubling.  Your review has caused us to take a serious look at the systems we have in place to handle our day to day operations and we will be making modifications as appropriate. Thank you again for sharing your experience with us. It's not common that we get the sort of feedback you provided, and although it is discouraging to read, it will help us make our hotel even better in the future.  Let me apologize again that your stay was not completely satisfying, and assure you that we will continue to listen to our guests in forums like this one.  I hope we have addressed your concern satisfactorily, and that you would give us the pleasure of having you as a guest again at this hotel or any other Extended Stay Hotels brand location in the future.

Summary: Good location and price for Disney.  Great service at the desk.  Rooms are decent and very quiet. the kitchenette was handy to have, and we enjoyed watching the fireworks from the room.  Breakfast coffee not bad.  Room could have been a little cleaner.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your stay.  I'm glad that you enjoyed the location and the service provided.  Thank you again for your review.  However I would like to apologize regarding the cleanliness of your room during your stay and would like to assure you that we will make sure that we inspect each and every room before a guest checks in. We look forward to seeing you again, should your travels bring you back to our area.

Summary: My son & l stayed at the hotel as we wanted to be close to disneyland.The hotel itself was nothing fancy but the price to stay was great.The room was clean when we arrived,beds weren't great but okay.The staff lead by Jay were extremely helpful & friendly the whole time we were there,check in & out was easy.Disneyland was easy walking distance.Would definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your stay.  It's great to hear that you were very happy with your stay.  Thank you again for your review.  We look forward to seeing you again, should your travels bring you back to our area.

Summary: The 800 reservation line has no clue what rooms are actually available at the hotel.  You can reserve one room and be given another, smaller, non accomodating room when you arrive.  And don't plan on actually getting any breakfast, the Costco muffins are gone within minutes of being put out.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your stay.  I sincerely apologize that you had an unpleasant stay with us.  To prevent this from happening again, my entire team has been trained on how to handle these types of situations. If you would like to discuss this further, please do not hesitate to contact me at acc@extendedstay.com.  We hope that you will give us the opportunity to provide you with a better stay the next time you're in the area.

Summary Heading: The staff make the hotel liveable
Summary: The best thing I can say about the hotel is that the staff work extra-hard to make sure that they meet your needs and that you have a pleasant stay.  I would say, however, that the condition of the rooms and common areas leaves a bit to be desired.  Although the hotel is touted as being "recently rennovated," it is clear that it gets HEAVY traffic from the convention center and Disney crowds.  We had barely any dishes in the kitchen and no towels for the very tiny and cold swimming pool (they were all in use throughout the hotel).  We also found a ton of hair all over the room and things seemed just dingy and over-used.  Stains on the counter top, water mineral deposits on the water filter and coffee maker, etc.  Since there is a kitchen available and people cook there, you are
Manager Response: I recently received a copy of your review, and wanted to take a moment to respond.  Our company prides itself on excellent guest service, so it was gratifying to read your feedback about our staff.  I would like to give you my most heartfelt apology regarding the part of your stay that was not satisfactory. As this hotel’s manager, I challenge our staff to continually improve the experience of our guests, from the cleanliness of our rooms, to the courteous professionalism of our staff.  Unfortunately, in your situation, it is clear that we were unsuccessful in achieving these goals.  Given our belief that guests like you are our most valuable asset, this failure is particularly troubling. Your review has caused us to take a serious look at the systems we have in place to handle our day to day operations and we will be making modifications as appropriate. It's not common that we get the sort of feedback you provided, and although it is discouraging to read, it will help us make our hotel even better in the future.  Let me apologize again that your stay was not completely satisfying, and assure you that we will continue to listen to our guests in forums like this one.  I hope we have addressed your concern satisfactorily, and that you would give us the pleasure of having you as a guest again at this hotel or any other Extended Stay Hotels brand location in the future.

Summary Heading: Once again I had a problem with Extended Stay
Summary: So a few years ago I went to Long Beach CA and stayed in the Extended Stay down there (4105 East Willow Street) and I had a HUGE issue with the room cleanliness to where I had to go down to the front desk and hand them the chair that was splattered in some form of human discharge.  I contacted the company numerous times to complain and nothing happened.  Well I went to Anaheim recently and I thought to myself...it's been years since that bad experience and it's a totally different area so I'll stay there and safe some money.  Once again room cleanliness was an issue...this time it wasn't quite that bad but it was still pretty gross. There were crumbs all over the counter top and paper all over the floor. When I told the front desk the next day (I check in super late and just
Manager Response: I received a copy of your review, and wanted to take a moment to personally respond.  I sincerely apologize that you encountered the problems you did during your stay with us.  In response to your feedback, I am always happy to hear what guests have to say, we try to keep everyone happy but there are challenges we all face and appreciate any comments.  I am grateful for the feedback you provided so we are able to continually improve our hotel.  If you have any additional feedback, please reach out to me at acc@extendedstay.com.  We would love to have another chance to provide you with a better experience at our hotel the next time you're in town.

Summary: Originally I had reserved 1 queen bed but got put into a room with 2 queen beds. I immediately removed the comforter to inspect the bed and came across a huge stain on the bed. Then noticed there was hair on the comfortor as well. I did the same to the other bed and saw hair as well. I went into the bathroom to wash my hands and went to use a towel but noticed there was brown stains not only on 1 towel but 3. Then noticed hair on the walls and in the shower. I called the front desk and he claimed he was too busy and he would call us back but never did so we had to call him. We then just went down to the front desk and were told he could refund our money but we would have to leave the hotel and find another hotel or be put into a smoking room. We agree to go to the smoking room
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay.  Given our company's commitment to superior guest satisfaction, I was disheartened to read that your stay wasn't 100% satisfactory.  Please understand how truly sorry I am. The experience you described is truly regrettable. We strive to ensure that our guests have an exceptional stay.  As this hotel’s manager, I can assure you that I have brought each of the issues you expressed to the attention of our staff. We know that we did not get to be a member of America’s number one family of extended stay hotels over night; we did it by focusing on one customer at a time.  We know that a totally satisfied customer is one who will come back and stay with us again.  That is why we take your review so seriously.  It reminds us that despite all of the regular praise we receive, we still have room to improve. Although it is unusual for a guest to have the experience you did while staying with us, we would like to use your account to help us make our hotel even better.  Again, I am deeply sorry that you did not have a completely enjoyable stay at our hotel, and I promise that we are focused on total guest satisfaction every day.  Please don't hesitate to reach out to me at this hotel at 714-502-9988 or by via email at acc@extendedstay.com.

Summary: The good news is that its only about 15 minute walk to Disneyland.  There is a small kitchen area, even though it says that there is dishes. silveware and such, dont fully trust it.  We had to go down and get a different toaster from the front desk because the one that was in room 204. Would burn one side, not cook the other side, and never pop, but the toaster they gave us to replace that one would only cook one set of toast then it would buzz like its over heating for the next 20 minutes.  We had to purchase a knife and a small frying pan ( we didnt want this trip to be full of take out and whatever else) ... and some plates. (our room had 2 plates, and 2 bowls, 1 fork, 1 spoon, 2 coffee cups, three drinking glasses.) there was a 2 burner stove top, apartment sized fridge, two
Manager Response: I received a copy of your review and wanted to thank you for sharing your experience at our hotel. I am glad that you enjoyed how close the hotel to Disneyland however I sincerely apologize for the problems you encountered with your room and your stay with us. In response to your feedback I will be addressing these issues with my entire staff. And please accept my apologies regarding the way you were treated unkindly. I am very disappointed that you left feeling that way and will work to improve our staff to avoid that in the future. If you would like to discuss this further please do not hesitate to contact me at acc@extendedstay.com. I do hope that you will return to our hotel or any other Extended Stay America should the need arise in the future.

Summary: This ESA hotel is tucked away on a quiet, convenient street next to the hub of Katella Ave and Harbor Blvd. (Heading west on Katella from the 5 freeway, you take a right on S. Clementine -  the second street after S. Anaheim Blvd., one block before Harbor).  This location bypasses the parking stress of the hotels on Harbor Blvd., which is often paid parking.  Here, the parking is effortless and free, and you don't have to put one of those tacky parking passes on your dash.    Fast, friendly staff for check-in. Thank you.  Facing west we could watch the Disneyland fireworks from our room (yay!). It was quiet at night, so we slept well.  You are right next to Anaheim Gardenwalk, with its many good restaurants including Cheesecake Factory (great happy hour), Bubba Gumps, P.F.
Manager Response: I received a copy of your review, and wanted to thank you for your kind words. It's great to hear that you were thrilled with your stay. Thank you for choosing Extended Stay Hotels.  We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: My recent stay at this property was a refreshing change. Many hotel/motel chains seem to pressure their employees to push good service to the limit, just short of pestering guests. Not so at Extended Stay -Anaheim. My checkin was quick and efficient, and I was asked if I needed anything like a toothbrush or dishsoap before going to my nicely modern good-sized non-smoking room that didn't (as with many chains) smell like it'd been deodorized after being smoked in. It looked, smelled and felt clean and towels & linens were spotless. The person who'd checked me in called about 20 minutes later on the room's landline phone, asking how the room was. My response, "It's wonderful, thank you!" Having never stayed in an Extended Stay America, the fully equipped kitchen with fridge,
Manager Response: I would like to personally thank you for taking time out to write such wonderful things about your experience at Extended Stay America Orange County - Anaheim Convention Center. Our hotel is totally committed to the satisfaction of every guest who walks through our doors, which is why it is so rewarding to get feedback like yours; it tells us that we are delivering on that commitment. I and the entire staff at our hotel thank you for your very kind words, and we would love to see you here again. Please don't hesitate to call me for your future stays here at 714-502-9988 or any other Extended Stay Hotels location.

Summary Heading: I have to find a maid and get towels myself?
Summary: +1 star for free parking and close distance to Disneyland (~15 minute walk) +1 star for functional kitchenette with nice full sized fridge (saw families bringing in groceries and even a crock pot!)  Everything else during our stay did not meet my expectations and I don't think I would be staying here ever again or recommend family and friends. I'll try to make this review short.  - took ~30 minutes to check in... and also two more trips back downstairs to the front desk to have our key card fixed since it would not open our room - the bathroom only had one set of towels, not including a floor mat towel, so I called the front desk and they told me that they didn't have any at the moment but if I found a maid with a cart to ask them... but I was already running late to dinner
Manager Response: I recently received a copy of your review of our hotel. Our company prides itself on providing great service and great rooms at great rates, which is why I was so disappointed to read your post. Please accept my most sincere apologies. As this hotel’s manager, I challenge our staff to continually improve the experience of our guests, from the cleanliness of our rooms, to the courteous professionalism of our staff. Unfortunately, in your situation, it is clear that we were unsuccessful in achieving these goals. Given our belief that guests like you are our most valuable asset, this failure is particularly troubling. Your review has caused us to take a serious look at the systems we have in place to handle our day to day operations and we will be making modifications as appropriate. Let me apologize again that your stay was not completely satisfying, and assure you that we will continue to listen to our guests in forums like this one or directly, and that you would give us the pleasure of having you as a guest again at this hotel or any other brand location in the future.

Summary Heading: A positive experience during a time of loss and grief!
Summary: I had to stay at this hotel for over a month due to my son's critical illness.  My son passed away during my stay there and the staff was very compassionate and caring.  Since I live on the East Coast, friends and family came by the hotel to express their condolencies.  We were given extra chairs and special accommodations.  The hotel had been refurbished, was very clean and now even offers a continental breakfast!  I had stayed here before but this experience was special and I will never forget it thanks to the day and evening front desk staff.
Manager Response: I received a copy of your review, and wanted to thank you for your kind words. It's great to hear that you were thrilled with your stay. Thank you for choosing Extended Stay Hotels. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Great price, great location, and great rooms!
Summary: Before booking our 2 night stay I was a little hesitant based on some of the other reviews.. But we took the chance anyway, and I'm glad we did! Rooms were nice, and clean and the staff was friendly and courteous :) front desk was a  little under staffed that weekend but even then staff was helpful. Would I stay there again? absolutely!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review of your stay.  I'm so pleased to hear that your stay with us was pleasant.  Thank you again for your kind words about the staff. We look forward to seeing you again, should your travels bring you back to our area.

Summary: We have stayed here twice in the last 3 months and we love it. The rooms are quiet and no one bothers you. The beds are so comfortable. They are always accommodating. Gave us extra blankets and sheets to make a special bed for our kids and moved us from smoking to non smoking! Seriously an amazing hotel

Summary Heading: What can not go wrong in a room!
Summary: 1/1/13- The grounds and lobby were nicely kept, and the location is a about 3/4 of a mile walking distance from Disneyland. There's no road noise to be had and there is 4 restaurants at the mall next door in easy walking distance. Parking is not extra fee, and is very adequent for the full hotel.  First of all, the management was very nice and gave us another room, but not initially and only when ants were invading our food from the ceiling above the next morning. This room on the 3rd floor (304)should have never been allowed to pass inspection. Lights and TV had been purposely disconnected by I may think another disguntled guest. One zip cord for the lights was crudely taped and reconnected with wire nuts to zip cord under the bed;. Being a contractor, this was not a proper

Summary: Olympic-Gold Customer service,(even when super busy) staff is professional & courteous. Housekeeping is helpful as well as timely. Televisions volume presets guarantee diminished "Neighborly-Noises". Parking lot is well illuminated at night making for a greater sense of security. Cooking facilities(stone counter-top!) are more than adequate, the near-full cooking & dinning-ware provided is sanitary, also if more is needed to suit your needs, made readily available. Towels and toiletries can be obtained at a moments notice. Rooms and hallways are well ventilated. AC/Heating units really help "Dial it all in" making for a hospitably comfortable stay. After-Hours Front Desk service is a definite +. The Grab-n'-Go breakfast can be a real bonus in a rushing schedule. Laundry

Summary: The room was FILTHY.   Only stayed 1 night because it was New Years Eve, and could not get another room that night.  We have two young kids that had to sleep. After a trip to 7-11 for Lysol spray we let the kids lay on the bed to sleep (without the blankets).  The floor was covered in pet hair. They said room had been clean just prior to us checking in (lol). We made them give half our money back.
Manager Response: I appreciate you taking the time to write a review of your experience with us. The pet hair you described is not acceptable, and I sincerely apologize for your experience. To prevent this from happening again, my housekeeping team has been re-trained so that this type of issue should not happen again. I appreciate you bringing this to our attention. I hope that you will contact me directly, at acc@extendedstay.com, should you wish to discuss this further. We would love to have another chance to provide you with a better experience at our hotel the next time you're in town.

Summary: We recently visited the end of September 2012, I arrived at night and an older lady was there checking people in, it took 40 minutes to check us in!!! I got in the room and was happy with the room it was good for the price we were paying. We went to sleep and the room was noisy I could hear the others in their rooms but finally drifted off to sleep. I woke up the next morning and as soon as I stepped out of bed I was surrounded by water, the carpet was SOAKING wet (right next to the bathroom wall) I walked towards the bathroom and the hardwood floor in the kitchen and connecting to the bathroom had water everywhere. My family got up and ready to go to Disneyland and told the lady at the front desk and the manager I think he was came by to look at it they said they problem would

We would love to have another chance to provide you with a better experience at our hotel the next time you're in town.

Summary: Stayed here on our recent visit to Disneyland. We did not know much about extended stays and were a little skeptical but once we got there, we were immediately relieved.  When you first drive in, the outside of the building and parking lot are very well taken care of and there is plenty of parking around the entire building. We got the the room sometimes at 2AM and were still able to get parking close to the entry. Once we went to the front desk, Vern(I hope I spelled it right!) was there to help us out with a smile and some funny jokes. Not only did he try and get us a great room but he also was able to make sure we got a view of the Disney fireworks from our room(We were at Disney anyways but the thought of it was very nice).  We went up to our room and once we got inside, it

Summary Heading: Excellent for the price and friendly staff
Summary: Staying for long time at this Hotel and the recent upgrade give us comfort .The new grab and go morning snacks and coffee is convenient when rushing .Unbeatable friendly staff- special mention to Sonia,Isa and  jay(manager)- If any inconvenient arises they fix it fast.House keeping is good-special mention to Angel- .Great location,close restaurants,freeways and you can even walk to disneyland.

Summary: My family of four just stayed six nights for the first time at an Extended Stay. I haved stayed all over Disneyland (including disneyland hotel) and for what we paid I was thrilled with the stay. If I was going away for a romantic get away I wouldn't have stayed here but while playing hard at Disney for the day and night it was just right for the coming back to for a good nights rest. The full size fridges were a bonus. The staff was most helpfully and tried hard to ensure we were happy. It was obvious that they run a lean ship with just one person on duty at the front desk so we would get our shuttle transfers (or any other needed room items)at night when it was quite.  The $5 shuttle  ($3for kids) I recommend as its fairly direct and you can use it all day for the one price.
Manager Response: I received a copy of your review, and wanted to thank you for your kind words. It's great to hear that you were thrilled with your stay.  Thank you for choosing Extended Stay Hotels.  We hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Great new beds and a new Grab and Go!!!
Summary: Oh my gosh new beds and food/coffee.  The customer service from the front desk, I think her name was Isa, she got us all set up for Disney.  Jay was great too, little noisy in the first room and he moved us without hesitation.

Summary: My daughter competed in the National American Miss pageant held at the Marriot Hotel a block away from this hotel.  We had the pleasure of seeing the rooms at the Marriot and may I say I felt our room was 10 times better and less expensive.  We were treated with smiles and pleasant nature of staff.  the rooms were oversized which may i say when you are dealing with a beauty queen is a blessing.  it was clean, convienent to both the pageant and Disney.  walking distance from both as well as downtoiwn Disney and great eating.  We are planning our next trip to Disney and WILL be staying there again.  Thank you to Jay and his amazing staff.

Summary Heading: There is a place like home
Summary: You know that famous saying, "there's no place like home?"  Well, at Extended Stay America in Anahiem, California, there is a place like home.  The rooms here are equipped with a small size kitchen so you can make home cooked meals while you are away on business or pleasure.  The newly renovated rooms also include beautiful wood flooring in the kitchen and bathroom and a flat screen television that can be viewed from the bed that feels like your own.  Aside from the more than comfortable living quarters that this hotel offers, the friendly and helpful staff always make you feel welcome. Summary Heading: A good base for the Disney parks
Summary: This was our first stay at extended stay, we were pleased with the facilities, but confounded as to why we were provided with two plates, two bowls, two towels etc when we booked for four. The front office provided more on request though.  The room was clear but smelt musty, as though it hadn't had fresh air for a long time.   The staff on the front desk did not know how to access emails to print something for us, so we had to wait for the manager, who was late.  Our room was next to a maintenance cupboard, and each night we were there, around midnight, something started to vibrate. One night it was so bad I had to call the front desk to ask them to make it stop. It was so loud it woke our children and the vibration could be felt through the beds.  It is reasonably close to the
