Summary: This hotel is the perfect example of the saying "if you put lipstick on a pig, its still a pig." The new paint and few renovations does little to improve the overall operation and cleanliness of this hotel. Our first room we were put in had ants covering the entire wall by the heat/ac unit. Second room had a terrible odor and wasn't clean. Found many other guests complaining at the time of my check in, some even left to other hotels. Dealt with two fire alarms, one with smoke entering our room and when we tried finding out what was wrong was yelled at by staff. Last day of check out, found a used pull up saturated in urine underneath shelf in the bathroom that had been there the entire time we were there and possibly longer. Pets are allowed in the hotel and numerous mornings

Summary Heading: Good  place for the price and location
Summary: Just had a three night stay here visiting the Happiest Place on earth. The price is really good and it's not far from the park at all. Room was decent and clean- thanks to Agustina for taking care of the room and having nice a clean for us :) the only issues was the front desk staff. It was hard to get someone for help- and on Sunday morning we tried calling three times with no one answering. Finally we went to the front desk- waited a few minutes and no one was there either. There was other guest there waiting as well. Hopefully the manager Jay Kholoma- we grabbed a card of course, will talk to the front desk staff. Other than that it was a great place to stay for sure.

Summary: After a full day of travel and work, I waited over an hour to check in. When I got to my room, I was impressed by the layout and cleanliness. This is the nicest Extended Stay that I've been to. I work for an advertising company and travel regularly for my job. I will be in this hotel for six weeks and it doesn't suck. There are numerous restaurants and shopping within walking distance from the hotel. Disneyland is minutes down the road, a big plus...

Summary: My best friend and I recently stayed at the Anaheim Convention Center hotel and as always,  the reservation and check in process was fast and super easy!  The hotel staff (Sonia, Vern, Caleb) including the Manager (Jay) are always friendly and offer their personal assistance to ensure our stay is perfect!  Our room was available a little early (which was wonderful) so that we could enjoy the pool for the afternoon.  Easy walk to Disneyland and there is a bus service that comes every 20 minutes.....the early morning breakfast is great for those of us who hit Disneyland very early.....the hotel was clean.....and the value is just perfect for us!  We will be returning very soon!

Summary Heading: Nastiest Bathroom & BED BUGS!!!!  What in the WORLD!
Summary: If you bring your own bed, bed sheets, towels and other amenities, including plates, silverwear and cups. Advertises that it's great for a long stay indeed it is as it has a kitchenette with full size refrigerator. Which is great if you need it.  Now here we go. Checking in we had to watch some guy typing one key at a time with the hunt and peck method we should've known that was it. Cut our losses and ran away. We got in our room and I felt my foot itch. I didnt think much of it. But since we had a family of four and they didn't give us an option of two beds and no roll aways were available we hopped in the car and hit the Target not too far away and bought air mattresses. Ugh. That night the kids were so tired we put them to sleep on the bed while we slept on the air

Summary Heading: Great Value That's Close To Disneyland!
Summary: My wife and I journeyed to the Left Coast to celebrate my birthday at the end of June. In researching affordable (yet clean) hotels located within walking distance of Disneyland, this hotel was such a great deal. It's about a 15 minute walk to Disneyland/California Adventure and we had no issues walking two-round trips each of the three days we went to the parks, as we found taking a break in the middle of the day refreshing. The staff was incredibly helpful and we had no problem exchanging towels or requesting extra coffee each day. The only thing I found a bit lacking was the pool...not bad but nothing special. Otherwise, I thought this hotel an excellent choice and would return in a heartbeat!

I'm well over 6'ft tall and the room was a disaster for me. the microwave was two feet of the floor causing me to have to bend down on my knees to use it, the shower head was a detachable one that was 4'ft from the shower floor and had a bench in it which made it small,  Also,I turned the bed sheets back only to find that I had hair all though out the bed, pillow cases included. Summary Heading: very nice hotel and great location

I also like the location, 5 minutes walk to anaheim walk which has many restaurants (cheesecake, PF Chang, California Pizza Kitchen, etc) and movie cinema.    I am a returning customer and will definetely have this hotel as my first choice when I am in town.

Summary Heading: Fairly close to the park but better options in the same price range
Summary: The good:The location of the hotel was decent.  It was about a 15 minute walk to the park which isnt bad unless your children are tired from walking all day already.  Parking was free which was a plus and there was a kitchenete.  They were working on painting and maintaining the outside of the building.  The not so Good: The hotel does show age.  We had a bath towel and hand towel with permenant stains.  The bathroom was small.  No free breakfast.  We go to Disneyland quite frequent and all things considered, I would look at other options in the area as there are similar properties a little closer and much better maintained at about the same rate.

Summary: There's something so nice about a property in which management and staff take obvious pride in maintaining with attentiveness.  It's a notch above the usual economy chains, it's a great location within quick and easy walking distance of Disneyland, there's attention paid to small details, and I never once had the feeling that my importance as a guest was ever questioned.  I had primary interaction with three desk personnel during my stay including (Manager) Jay Kholoma and ALL employees of this hotel were professional, extremely responsive, impeccably well-qualified to deal with all my interests - in short, the employees were by far the absolutely most positive aspect of what was, in total - a highly enjoyable stay. Summary: The location is the best feature about this hotel as it's only a short 10 minutes walk from the Main Gate at Disneyland, past Anaheim Garden Walk.  Otherwise the hotel did the job in that we booked last minute and it wasn't very expensive.    For some reason when we booked it defaulted to a smoking room, which we didn't see until we checked in and went to our room which we suspected had been smoked in.  Since all we did was drop off our stuff when we first arrived and headed straight to Disneyland we didn't think much of it but by the time we got back to the room at 11pm we were blown away by how bad the room smelled.  Turns out the entire 4th floor is smoking, which surprised us in general.  We did go right to the front desk and asked to be moved which they were able to
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay at our hotel. Summary: The hotel was obviously under staffed. There was only one old lady at the front desk and we waited for about 45 minutes to check in. We booked a suite but there was no bedding stuff provided for the sofa bed and no one picked up the phone at room service, so we need to go to the front desk to ask for pillows, sheet and blanket and come back to do the bedding by ourselves, of course another 30 minutes waiting to get the bedding stuff. There is no room service because it is an "extended stay"but they charge $119/nite+ 18% orange county tax. The location is good - about 15 minutes walk to Disneyland and is on a quiet street. The kitchen is not well equipped, only has one small pan and 2 plates. No shampoo etc. stuff provided so you need to bring your own.

Summary: We found the hotel by doing some fairly extensive Google searching for properties with easy access (and within walking distance) to Disney’s main gate. We stumbled over negative reviews AFTER we had booked our stay (and suffered a bit of initial trepidation), but were pleasantly surprised at how well the property worked for our needs.   We’re a family of four. The main purpose of our visit was Personal/Leisure – touring the Disney parks. We made our reservation directly on ExtendedStayHotels.com and used a AAA rate to receive a 10% discount on the room. We booked a single room with two double beds (two queens would have worked better for our needs, but this was acceptable). Summary: Found a last minute deal for this hotel close to Disneyland and was extremely happy with the room rate and the property! The rooms were modern, updated and CLEAN! We had a 2 queen/bed mini suite and althought it seemed a bit small, the price was GREAT and loved having the kitchenette available to us with a full size refrigerator. We ordered a roll away and the mattress (despite outward looks) was extremely confortbale! Parking was included in the room cost (mostly all other hotels in the area charge upwards of $15/day for parking!) and they also provided a free shuttle to/from Disneyland that stops right outside the front door! You can also walk if you have a good pair of shoes on (approx 15/20 minutes). The continental breakfast is good if you want to grab a quick prepackaged

I have a friend staying at the hotel and she fell and  fractured her wrist in her room. She went to the hospital and they gave her  a prescription for pain after applying a splint. My friend who is disabled  could not get her prescription filled. Jay, on his own time was kind enough  to take her prescription to the pharmacy and fill it for her. There aren'e  enogh people in te world like Jay. I am sending you this email to praise  your employees. Summary: First things first...I booked a room through Priceline and this hotel was my "name your own price".  I booked more than 1 month in advance.  Called to request a non smoking room due to a medical condition.  Was met with nothing but resistance when I contacted the hotel...also when I contacted Priceline.  However, when I called back during normal Ca hours ( and someone who didn't speak broken English) the matter was promptly resolved by Sonia.  I believe she is a true asset to this hotel.  Sonia was also the one who checked us in promptly and politely and delivered the room promised.  Rooms were amazing!!!  As a matter of fact my daughter wanted to hang out instead of head right into Disneyland.  No complaints and would def stay here again!!!  Would also like to mention the clerk

Summary: I am a long time Disneyland goer and we've stayed all over the Disneyland area. Finding a comfortable reasonably priced room is not always easy. But I found Extended Stay and read that they'd remodeled. The pictures looked good and the price was perfect. Upon arrival we were warmly greeted, and the lobby looked fantastic. Our room was nicely updated, all the way from the curtains, to the closet, to the floors, to the entire bathroom. The decor is great, the upgrades are beautiful, and we couldn't have been closer to Disneyland! My only gripe was the lack of lotion, shampoo and a hair dryer in our room, but the staff remedied that quickly. They offer grab-n-go breakfast, but with a full kitchen in your room, I'm not sure why you'd need it, but it's a nice little touch. We will

Summary Heading: Great Atmosphere, Great Service, Community Enviroment
Summary: This hotel is great for the price, FANTASTIC for the price actually, the front desk people were very nice, and always had interesting facts or ideas about things we could do in the area. The room itself was spotless(the whole property has just been renovated inside and out). Everything was practically brand new. It was a very close distance to Disney Resort and the Garden Walk, which was very convenient for dining out. For the price, the service, and the value, I'll definitely be staying here on my next trip to Orange County.

Summary: I was pleasantly surprised upon arrival to see how absolutely beautiful the place was! The lobby looked fresh and new and the room was clean and neat, and especially quiet (which was one thing I needed for certain). Nothing out of place and absolutely loved the layout of the kitchen. The staff was friendly, especially the lady that checked me in. I believe her name was Aisa? Maybe... Anyways, I was there for four nights and I couldn't have been more pleased. Staff was always willing to accomodate.

Summary: I believe this location has had some recent renovations from the other Extended Stay Locations i've visited. Upon pulling up to the Extended Stay America Anaheim Convention Center, I found it very easily with the new green and brown signage, parking was easy to find and upon entering the lobby it's very spacious and clean. I had come hoping for an early check in around 7am, as I called ahead and requested they said it would be okay, but I found that my room wouldn't be available until 9am.  The gentleman at the front desk seemed busy and couldn't accomidate me in time.. But once it was 9am, my room was ready for check in. Summary: It was convenient having a kitchen. It would have been great to have towels delivered instead of having to exchange them every night but overall this was a pleasant stay. Summary Heading: Words cannot discribe the stench and filth in this place
Summary: 1st mistake-checking in and not inspecting the room 2nd mistake-stepping out on the 4th floor  3rd mistake-not asking for a refund and walking out  This was the worst, worst hotel room that I have ever stayed in, the room was filthy! They must have just evicted their long term customer for the night and let us pay to stay in his/her room. We requested a non-smoking room, well the whole 4th floor reeked, lets just say Vegas casino's smell better, the staff surly knows this. ROOM 402-Immediately opened up the windows (the sills were covered in cigarette ashes, torn screens and some black substance). Summary: My husband and I are moving to Hawaii and made this place our "transition spot" after we'd sold our home, but before our move.  We had planned to stay here for a few weeks at best, but my husband's consulting job contract was extended and we have been here for 5+ months!  The staff here treats us like family and everything concern or need that I've asked them for has been complied with promptly.  The entire hotel has been renovated so we have comfy new queen size bed, a new flat screen TV and so much more.  The rooms are cleaned once a week for long term guests, but the hotel accomodates nightly stays as well. We have a full size refrigerator and a 2 burner stove and laundry facilities are on property too, so it's so convenient for us.  We couldn't have picked a better place for
